齐美尔首先分析了一般意义上的价值，以及货币与价值之间的关系。在他看来，价值存在于主体与客体的分离之中，“当我们需要的内容一开始反对我们，它就变成了客体…… 对象因而就形成了，它的特性是通过与主体的分离而被赋予的，主体同时建立它并且试图以它的欲求征服它，对我们而言这就是价值”①。在这之中，距离扮演着十分重要的角色。换言之，事物的价值存在于与我们之间的相对距离之中，如果事物与我们的距离太近，太容易得到，就没有价值。当然，如果距离太远，甚至远到无法得到的地步，也就同样没有什么价值。齐美尔认为，人们通过创造事物，从而创造了价值。但同时，这一创造过程又使自己与事物相分离，然后再寻求克服这一距离和摆脱困难的手段。显然，这中间的困难越大，手段就越有价值。在社会经济生活中，货币就具有这样的重要性。一方面，货币造成了人与物之间的距离，如果人们没有钱，就无法得到某物；另一方面，货币又能够帮助人们克服自己与物之间的距离，只要他有钱，就能得到任何有价值的东西。也就是说，货币在人们的社会生活中扮演着双重的角色，它既增加了人与物之间的距离，同时又提供了克服这种距离的途径。
齐美尔还分析了价值在 “世界观” 形成中的作用。在他看来，人们倾向于在生活的世界中寻找稳定的秩序，希望知道一事物的位置以及该事物与其他事物之间的关系。例如，人们创造出图腾崇拜和宗教仪式以调节人与神之间的关系，创造出价值以区别不同事物与人的关系，同时也使得不同事物之间可以相互比较、相互交换。这意味着，价值为人们提供了一个观察、理解世界的理性框架。
价值存在于主体与客体的分离之中，或者说存在于人的创造物与人本身的 “异化” 过程之中，这一观点具有重要意义。正是基于这一观点，齐美尔展开了对货币的分析。在他看来，货币为商品交换提供了一种普遍的价值标准。在货币出现之前，商品生产和交换就已经存在。然而，在无货币作为交换媒介的情况下，商品生产和交换只能以 “以货易货” 的形式存在，以这种形式进行的交换是非常困难的，用齐美尔的话说，就是抽象的商品价值无法具体化。货币的出现，为各种不同的商品提供了一种共同的度量标准，使各种不同的商品可以根据共同的度量标准来进行相互比较，这推动了商品的生产和交换，扩展了交换的深度和广度。在货币出现之前的 “以货易货” 的交换格局中，参与交换的货物在时间和空间跨度上都是有限的，货币的出现打破了这一局限。同时，货币的出现还极大地扩展了商品的种类，甚至人本身也成了商品，雇佣劳动和皮肉生意即是这种情况的一个明显例证。虽然说在货币出现之前，也可能存在雇佣劳动和皮肉生意，但在货币出现之后，这种情况才可能成为一种普遍现象。
齐美尔对于货币所做的分析的另一个重要特点，是把货币视为人类互动的一种形式。“货币完全是一种社会学现象，是人类互动的一种形式，其特性愈是脱颖而出，社会关系也就愈是集中、可靠和和谐。”①他强调，交换过程本身能够创造价值，或者说增加商品的价值。在他看来，参与交换的双方，只有在都认为售出较低价值的商品、换回较高价值的商品时，交换才成为可能。在以货币为媒介的情形中，对货币的追求也就因此而有特殊意义。在现代社会中，货币成为纯粹的交换工具，其价值只有在交换过程中才能实现，在此情况下，对货币本身的追求便成为目的。
齐美尔认为，货币的广泛使用具有深远的影响。首先，货币的使用使得人们能够更加抽象地对目的做思考。货币使得 “长远的计算、大规模的企业、长期的信用” 成为可能，并且促进了人们的思维方式的发展，因为货币交换行为，包含着更为复杂的心理过程，从而使 “理智能力和抽象思维成为我们这个时代的特征”②。货币的使用改变了知识及知识分子在社会中的地位。由于货币的使用，人们越来越精于计算，善于抽象思考。这无疑提高了知识在社会生活中的地位，同时也改变了社会的价值观念与行为规范，促进了文化向着知识层面进行根本性调整。其次，货币的使用推动了社会向理性化的方向发展，促进社会对量的计算的要求超过了质的因素。齐美尔说：“我们可以毫不费力地举出更多的例证来说明下面这些正在日益增长着的倾向：量的范畴主宰了质的范畴，或者说得更准确些就是质被消融在了量之中；越来越多地把因素从质当中剔除出去，只赋予这些因素具体的运动形式；把一切依特殊地、个别地、性质地而定的事物都解释为那些无特色的因素和意识 —— 它们只受数量化规定性的影响 —— 之或多或少、或大或小、或宽或窄、或频或疏，等等，尽管靠这些致命的手段永远也不可能彻底地实现这些倾向的目标。…… 我们生活的一个主要的趋势 —— 把质化约为量 —— 在货币中达到其最高和最独一无二完美的呈现。在这里，货币又一次成为发展进程中的一种文化历史序列的顶峰，而这一点无疑决定了金钱的方向。”③
在齐美尔看来，货币的使用，不仅促进了货物交流，同时也提高了人与人之间互动的频率。因为有了货币，人们不仅能参与生活于其中的初级群体的活动，而且能够与更多的人互动，参加到各种各样的次级群体中去。货币的使用改进了人与人之间的关系，促进了社会的团结。一个人之所以将货物卖给另一个人，接受另一个人所付出的钱，是因为他相信，在将来的某个时候，他能够付出他所得到的钱，买回他所需要的东西。也就是说，只有在人与人之间存在着信任关系时，货币才能存在，以之为媒介的交易才能进行。同样道理，货币经济的发展促进了这种信任关系的普及。
齐美尔认为，货币的出现也改变了政府行为的景观。一方面，正是有了货币，政府才能对遥远的地方征税，才能向其官员及其雇员支付薪俸。这说明大规模的国家及中央集权政府的出现，是与货币经济的发展分不开的。另一方面，政府也必须尽力保持社会的稳定，只有在此基础上，它发行的货币才能为其公民所接受。
而货币对个人的影响，则主要体现在以下几个方面。首先，货币作为最一般性的工具，和其他参与交换的商品不同，其本身并不能决定自己的用途。这意味着，货币使个人有了更多的选择自由，有了更多的表现自己的方式，社会也就因而向多样化的方向发展。其次，货币使得人们能够具有多种不同的人际关系。个人可以通过付费参加各种交往活动，与各种各样的人保持接触，从而促进社会群体数量的增加及其形式、内容的多样化。再次，货币在使人们能够接触多种多样的人的同时，也导致个人更加封闭、更加孤独，这已成为现代社会无法回避的一个通病。其原因在于货币的出现，使人们倾向于数量的计算，抛弃了交易过程这一特殊的互动过程中的情感因素，人对人的了解只限于货币的多少，这与货币出现之前的情况大相径庭。在现代社会中，随着分工日趋细致，人们的生活越来越依赖于其他人的劳动。但同时，与我们直接相关的只是他人的社会角色，而不是具体的活生生的人，这导致了社会关系的非人格化。最后，在货币的强力冲击之下，许多人的人生观也发生了剧烈的变化：一些人变得 “愤世嫉俗”，而另一些人则变得对任何事物都 “无动于衷”。在前一种人看来，金钱可以买来一切东西：美貌、地位、智慧甚至人格，令任何庄严、神圣、崇高的东西都面临着挑战。而在后一类人看来，既然所有的东西都可以买卖，唯一的区别只是价格的不同，那么事物之间根本就没有什么本质的区别。毫无疑问，后一类人在货币的冲击之下，已丧失了辨别事物之根本价值的能力。
总之，在齐美尔看来，货币在现代社会中，已经成为一种具有自身生命力的独立存在，它使我们能够对各种截然不同的事物，从量的角度进行精确的度量和比较。与货币经济相伴随的客观文化的发展，已经导致了社会生活中的计算和理性，以及非人格化的冷漠、傲慢和玩世不恭，从而构成对人性、个性和自由的最大威胁，造成了资本主义社会的 “文化悲剧”。不过应当指出的是，齐美尔尽管揭示了货币经济可能产生的各种危害，却并没有督促我们返回传统社会的所谓淳朴、人性的生活中去，因为在他看来，货币是人性发展的一个必然阶段和产物，是一种绝对、纯粹的工具，是无法超越的。正因为如此，齐美尔一方面不否认现代文明发展的必然性，另一方面又对这种发展抱有一种悲观主义的态度。
本章小结
齐美尔通过提出并回答 “社会是如何成为可能的” 这一问题，确立了将社会交往形式作为社会学研究对象的基本思想，从而为社会学的产生奠定了重要的理论基础；并且基于这种观念，对社会互动的形式和过程进行了深入的探讨，同时尝试将量化方法引入社会学，研究群体规模大小对群体互动性质的影响；通过对主观文化、客观文化和社会分化问题，尤其是货币问题的社会学分析，深刻揭示了现代工业社会的内在矛盾，以及资本主义的内在 “文化悲剧”。正如科塞（Lewis Coser，1913-2003）所说：“齐美尔永远和涂尔干、韦伯一样有力地激发着社会学的想象力。”①但是我们必须指出，齐美尔的社会学理论基本上是一系列哲理式论述，缺乏经验的、实证的理论和方法，这是它与同时代的涂尔干的实证社会学说相比的欠缺与不足。

01x03 - 侯默的艰难历程
(chattering)
（喋喋不休声）
Mrs. Krabappel: Now class, I don’t want this field trip校外考察 to be a repeat of our infamous visit to the Springfield State Prison州立监狱. So, I want you all to be on your best behavior, especially you, Bart Simpson.
克拉伯珀尔夫人：好了，同学们，我可不希望这次郊游重演我们臭名昭著的斯普林菲尔德州立监狱之行。所以，我希望你们都表现得最好，尤其是你，巴特·辛普森。  
Bart: Mrs. Krabappel, I didn’t unlock that door打开门锁.
巴特：克拉伯珀尔夫尔夫人，我没有打开那扇门。  
(tires screech)
（轮胎尖叫声）  


                  
                   Otto: Uh, sorry, little dudes. Party hardy was tardy迟到的.  奥托：呃，抱歉了，小家伙们。派对狂欢迟到了。  
                  
                

Party hardy: This is a slang phrase popular in the 1980s and 90s. It means “to party with great enthusiasm and energy,” often involving late nights and loud music. This phrase perfectly captures Otto’s heavy-metal-loving, party-animal lifestyle.


Mrs. Krabappel: All right, children. Count off.报数
克拉巴佩尔太太：好了，孩子们。清点人数。
Students: One, two, three.
学生们：一，二，三。
Bart: Hey, Otto. Hey, Ottoman.
巴特：嘿，奥托。嘿，奥斯曼。
Otto: Hey, Bart dude.
奥托：嘿，巴特伙计。
Bart: Any new tattoos, Otto?
巴特：奥托，有新纹身吗？
Otto: Oh, funny you should ask, man. This morning I woke up with this one.
奥托：哦，真巧你问，伙计。今天早上我醒来就有了这个。
Bart: Cool. I want one.
巴特：酷。我也想要一个。
Otto: Huh. Not till you’re 14, my little friend.
奥托：嗯。要到你十四岁才行，我的小朋友。
Mrs. Krabappel: Bart! Bart Simpson! Take your seat, Bart.
克拉贝佩尔太太：巴特！巴特·辛普森！坐好，巴特。
Bart: Oh, please, Mrs. Krabappel, not next to Wendell. He pukes🤮 on every bus ride. No offense,无意冒犯， Wendell.
巴特：哎呀，克拉贝佩尔太太，不要让我坐在温德尔旁边。他每次坐公交都会吐。没冒犯的意思，温德尔。
Wendell: Oh.
温德尔：哦。  
Mrs. Krabappel: Be that as it may,即便/尽管如此 it’s the only seat left, so get in there!
克拉巴贝尔夫人：尽管如此，那是唯一剩下的座位，快坐下！  
(laughing)
（笑）  
Wendell: Please try not to shake the seat like that.
温德尔：请尽量不要那样摇动座位。 
Mrs. Krabappel: Now, class, remember. Do not stick伸出 any part of your body out the window. We all know the tragic悲惨的 story of the young man who stuck his arm out the window把胳膊伸出窗外 and had it ripped off撞掉 by a big truck coming in the other direction.
克拉巴贝尔夫人：现在，班上同学们，记住。不要把身体任何部位伸出窗外。我们都知道那个悲惨的故事：有个年轻人把胳膊伸出窗外，被迎面而来的大卡车扯掉了。 
Bart: And I was that boy.
巴特：而我就是那个男孩。  
(laughter)
（笑声）  
Mrs. Krabappel: Uh, Bart Simpson, sit down! I’ve had just about enough of your tomfoolery.
克拉伯佩尔夫人：呃，巴特·辛普森，坐下！我已经受够了你的荒唐行径。
Wendell: Oh, I don’t feel so hot.
温德尔：哦，我觉得不太舒服。
(chattering)
（叽叽喳喳） 
Kid: Look, there’s our school again.
小孩：看，那又是我们的学校。 
Mrs. Krabappel: Otto, are you sure you—
克拉巴佩尔夫人：奥托，你确定你——  
Otto: It’s a shortcut近路, Mrs. K. Trust me.
奥托：这是捷径，K 夫人。相信我。  
Bart: Mrs. Krabappel! Mrs. Krabappel!
巴特：克拉巴佩尔老师！克拉巴佩尔老师！
Mrs. Krabappel: Bart, not another word out of you, or I’ll subject you to the humiliation of making you sing in front of the class.
克拉巴佩尔老师：巴特，你别再说话了，否则我就要让你在全班面前唱歌，让你出丑。
Bart: Can I pick挑选 the song?
巴特：我可以挑歌吗？  
Mrs. Krabappel: No. The song will be “John Henry Was a Steel Drivin’ Man.”
克拉巴佩尔老师：不行。你要唱的歌是《约翰·亨利是个钢钉工人》。

Man: The dip sign, the 15 miles per hour speed limit on Main Street.
男子：下凹路标，主街 15 英里每小时的限速标志。
(booing) （嘘声）
Man: I give you the man whose very name is synonymous with safety. Homer Simpson!
男：我把那位其名字本身就与安全同义的人介绍给你们。荷默·辛普森！
Crowd: (cheering) Homer! Homer!
人群：（欢呼）荷默！荷默！
Homer: Thank you. Unlike most of you, I am not a nut. Just a good, honest American who opposes wrongdoing… and especially carelessness wherever they occur.
荷默：谢谢。和你们大多数人不同，我不是个疯子。我只是一个正直、诚实的美国人，反对不法行为……尤其反对发生在任何地方的粗心大意。
Mr. Burns: (groans) Look at that man. He has the crowd in the palm of his hand. Ah, I haven’t seen anything like it since Jolson. Who is he?
伯恩斯先生：（呻吟）看看那个人。他把观众玩得团团转。啊，自从乔尔森之后我还没见过这样的。那是谁？
Smithers: That’s Homer Simpson, sir. He used to work here in the plant, but we fired him for gross incompetence.
史密瑟斯：那是侯默·辛普森，长官。他以前在厂里上班，但我们因严重无能把他开除了。
Mr. Burns: Oh, so that’s his little game. Get this Simpson character up here right now.
伯恩斯先生：哦，原来那是他的把戏。现在就把这个辛普森叫上来。
Smithers: But Mr. Burns—
史密瑟斯：但伯恩斯先生——
Mr. Burns: I said do it! Now do it! Do it! Do it!
伯恩斯先生：我说做就做！现在就做！做！做！
Homer: Our lives are at the hands of men no smarter than you or I, many of them, incompetent boobs. I know this because I worked alongside them, gone bowling with them, watched them pass me over for promotions time and again. And I say, this stinks!
侯默：我们的生活掌握在和你我差不多聪明程度的人手中，他们中有很多是无能的笨蛋。我知道这点，因为我曾和他们并肩工作，和他们一起去打保龄球，看着他们一次又一次把晋升机会从我身边夺走。我想说，这真是太臭了！
(cheering) （欢呼）
Smithers: Hey. Hey, Simpson, Burns wants to talk to you privately.
史密瑟斯：嘿。嘿，辛普森，伯恩斯想单独和你谈谈。
Homer: Privately? 侯默：私下？
Smithers: Yes. 史密瑟斯：是的。
Homer: Stay here. I’ll be right back.
侯默：待在这儿。我马上回来。
(cheering) （欢呼）
Mr. Burns: Ah, Homer Simpson, at last we meet.
伯恩斯先生：啊，侯默·辛普森，终于见到你了。
Homer: Same here. 侯默：彼此彼此。
Mr. Burns: Simpson, I want you to rejoin our power plant family.
伯恩斯先生：辛普森，我希望你重新回到我们的发电厂大家庭。
Homer: Sorry. No can do.
侯默：抱歉，办不到。
Mr. Burns: Hear me out, Simpson! I don’t want you to come back as a technical supervisor or supervising technician or whatever the hell you used to do. I want you to be in charge of safety here at the plant.
伯恩斯先生：听我说，辛普森！我不想让你回去当技术主管或监督技师之类的。我要你负责制造厂的安全。
Homer: Safety? But, sir, if truth be known, I actually caused more accidents around here than any other employee. There were even a few doozies no one ever found out about.
侯默：安全？可是，长官，说实话，我实际上比这里任何员工都造成过更多事故。还有几起大事故没人发现。
Mr. Burns: The generous offer I’m making is good for exactly… 30 seconds, Simpson.
伯恩斯先生：我给你的这个慷慨提议只有效……整整 30 秒，辛普森。
Homer: (thinking) Me, in charge of safety? This place could blow sky high. Nah. I’ll concentrate on my work now. Gee, this guy’s desk sure is big. I can’t let Marge support the family. This guy’s got the cleanest shirt I’ve ever seen. What should I—
侯默：（思考）我来当安全负责人？这地方可能会炸个天翻地覆。算了。我还是专心干我的本职工作吧。哎呀，这家伙的办公桌真大。我不能让玛姬（或玛吉）养家。这家伙的衬衫是我见过最干净的。我应该——
Mr. Burns: Simpson, time’s up.
伯恩斯先生：辛普森，时间到了。
Homer: Mmm, what the hey. I’ll take the job.
侯默：嗯，算了。我接受这份工作。
Mr. Burns: Excellent. Your first duty will be to step out on the balcony and tell that crowd this plant is safe.
伯恩斯先生：太好了。你的第一项任务是在阳台上向那群人宣布这家工厂是安全的。
Homer: What?
侯默：什么？
Mr. Burns: Go on, Homer.
伯恩斯先生：继续，侯默。
Crowd: Homer! Homer! Homer! Homer! Homer! (cheering, applauding)
人群：侯默！侯默！侯默！侯默！侯默！（欢呼、鼓掌）
Marge: Yeah, Homer! 玛姬：加油，侯默！
Lisa: Go, Dad!
丽萨：加油，爸爸！
Homer: Ladies and gentlemen, this plant is— Oh, sit tight. I’ll be right back.
侯默：女士们、先生们，这家工厂——哦，坐稳。我马上回来。
(cheering)
（欢呼）
Homer: I can’t do it, Mr. Burns.
侯默：我做不到，伯恩斯先生。
Mr. Burns: You mean, you’re willing to give up a good job and a raise just for your principles?
伯恩斯先生：你的意思是，你愿意为了原则放弃一份好工作和加薪？
Homer: Mmm. When you put it that way, it does sound a little farfetched, but that’s the lug you’re lookin’ at! And I vow to continue spending every free minute I have… crusading for safety! Of course, I’d have a lot less of those free minutes if you gave me the job.
侯默：嗯。你这么一说，听起来确实有点牵强，但那就是你正在看的傻瓜！我发誓会把每一个空闲时间都用来……为安全而奋斗！当然，如果你把这份工作给我，我的空闲时间就会少多了。
Mr. Burns: Mmm. You’re not as stupid as you look or sound… or our best testing indicates. You’ve got the job. Now get to work!
伯恩斯先生：嗯。你并不像你看起来或听起来的那么愚蠢……至少我们的最佳测试显示如此。你被录用了。现在去工作吧！
Homer: I’ll get to work, but first I have to say good-bye to some friends.
侯默：我会去工作的，但首先我要和一些朋友道别。
(door sliding open) （门滑开）
(cheering) （欢呼）
Homer: Friends, you have come to depend on me as your safety watchdog so you won’t scrape yourself or stub your toes or blow yourselves up. But you can’t depend on me all your life. You have to learn that there’s a little Homer Simpson in all of us, and I’m going to have to live without your respect and awe. The only reason I’m telling you this is… I’m going to be leaving you.
侯默：朋友们，你们已经习惯把我当成你们的安全看护人，这样你们就不会划伤自己、撞到脚趾或把自己炸了。但你们不可能一辈子都依赖我。你们得学会，每个人心里都有一点侯默·辛普森，而我将不得不没有你们的尊重和敬畏地活下去。我之所以告诉你们这个……是因为我要离开你们了。
(gasps)
（倒抽一口气）
Homer: But don’t worry. I have just been appointed the new safety inspector at this very plant… with a big, fat raise!
侯默：但别担心。我刚刚被任命为这家工厂的新安全检查员……而且还拿到了一大笔加薪！
(cheering) （欢呼声）
Bart: Hey, that’s my pop up there! Dad, watch out!
巴特：嘿，那是我爸爸在上面！爸爸，小心！
Homer: (screaming) Whoa, easy! Don’t drop me. Be careful.
侯默：（尖叫）哇，小心点！别把我掉了。小心点。
Crowd: Homer! Homer! Homer!
人群：侯默！侯默！侯默！

01x04 - 没有什么比家更丢脸的
Bart: Yeah.
巴特：耶。
Lisa: Yeah.
丽萨：耶。
Bart: Oh, yeah?
巴特：哦，是吗？
Lisa: Yeah!
丽萨：耶！
Bart: Oh, yeah?
巴特：哦，是吗？
Lisa: Yeah.
丽萨：是的。
Bart: Oh, yeah?
巴特：哦，是吗？
Lisa: Yeah!
丽莎：耶！
Homer: Hey, what’s the problem here?
霍默：嘿，这里有什么问题吗？
Lisa: We were fighting over which one of us loves you more.
丽莎：我们在争谁更爱你。
Homer: You were? (sniffles) Aw, well, go ahead.
霍默：你们？（抽泣）哦，好吧，说吧。
Bart: You love him more.
巴特：你更爱他。
Lisa: No, you do.
丽莎：不，是你更爱他。
Bart: No, I don’t.
巴特：不，我不爱他。
Lisa: Yes, you do!
丽莎：爱！你就是爱！
Bart: No, I don’t.
巴特：不，我不愿意。
Homer: Look, you better get this all out of your system right now! I don’t want you embarrassing me at my boss’s picnic. Mmm. Marshmallow. (belches)
荷马：听着，你最好现在把这些都发泄出来！我可不想你在我老板的野餐会上让我出丑。嗯，棉花糖。（打嗝）
Marge: Homer!
玛吉：霍默！
Homer: I’m trying to get at least some of the unfortunate noises out of my system while I can, Marge. I don’t want to embarrass myself at the company picnic.
荷马：我想趁现在把一些不幸的声音发泄出来，玛吉。我可不想在公司野餐会上丢脸。
Marge: (disgruntled groan)
玛吉：（不悦地呻吟）
Homer: Are you sure that’s enough? You know how the boss loves your delicious gelatin desserts.
霍默：你确定这些够吗？你知道老板多喜欢你做的美味果冻甜点。
Marge: Oh, Homer, Mr. Burns just said he liked it… once.
玛姬：哦，霍默，伯恩斯先生只是说他喜欢……一次。
Homer: Marge that’s the only time he’s ever spoken to me without using the word “bonehead.”
霍默：玛姬，那是他唯一一次跟我说话而没有叫我“蠢蛋”。
Homer: There it is, kids! Stately Burns Manor. Heaven on Earth. Okay, now look, my boss is gonna be at this picnic so I want you to show your father some love and/or respect.
霍默：到了，各位！庄严的伯恩斯庄园。人间天堂。好了，听着，我的老板会来这次野餐，所以我要你们向你们的父亲表示一些爱意和/或尊重。
Lisa: Tough choice.
莉萨：艰难的选择。
Bart: I’m thinking respect.
巴特：我在想尊重。
Mr. Burns: Good to see you. Glad you could make it.
伯恩斯先生：很高兴见到你。很高兴你能来。
Man: Oh, thank you, Mr. Burns, I’m so glad you invited us.
男子：哦，谢谢你，伯恩斯先生，我真高兴你邀请了我们。
Tom: Not me. I had to miss little league for this.
汤姆：不是我。我为了这个都错过了小联盟棒球。
Man: Quiet, Tom.
男士：安静，汤姆。
Mr. Burns: Oh, please, please don’t fight. Just go out back and have a good time. Fire that man, Smithers. I don’t want him or his unpleasant family to ruin my picnic.
伯恩斯先生：哦，拜托，拜托别打架。快到后院去好好玩。史密瑟斯，开除那个人。我不想让他和他那不讨人喜欢的家人破坏我的野餐。
Smithers: He’ll be gone by the tug-of-w*r, sir.
史密瑟斯：他们到拔河比赛前就会被赶走的，长官。
Mr. Burns: Excellent.
伯恩斯先生：太好了。
Homer: Uh, afternoon, Mr. Burns.
霍默：呃，下午好，伯恩斯先生。
Mr. Burns: Hi. Hello, there, uh— uh—
伯恩斯先生：嗨。你好，呃—呃—
Homer: (whispering) Simpson, Homer.
霍默：（低声）辛普森，霍默。
Smithers: Here you go, sir.
史密瑟斯：给您，长官。
Mr. Burns: Ah! Oh, yes. Uh, oh, and this must be your lovely wife, Marge. Oh, and look at little, uh, Lisa. Why she’s growing like a weed. And this must be, uh, Brat.
伯恩斯先生：啊！哦，是的。呃，哦，这一定是你可爱的妻子，玛姬。哦，看看小，呃，丽萨。她长得真快。还有这一定是，呃，小淘气。
Bart: Bart.
巴特：巴特。
Homer: Don’t correct the man, Brat. Oh, boss, look what we brought, gelatin desserts.
霍默：别纠正他，淘气。哦，老板，看看我们带了什么，果冻甜点。
Mr. Burns: Oh, for the love of Peter. That’s all anybody brought. Some damn fool went around telling everyone I love that slimy goop. Well, toss it in the pile over there. And… make yourselves at home.
伯恩斯先生：哦，求你了，彼得。这就是大家带来的全部。某个该死的傻瓜到处跟人说我喜欢那黏糊糊的玩意儿。好吧，把它扔到那堆里去。然后……随便你们，像在自己家一样。
Bart: Hear that, Dad? You can lie around in your underwear and scratch yourself.
巴特：听见了吗，爸爸？你可以穿着内裤躺着挠痒痒了。
Homer: Now, you listen to me!
霍默：现在，你听我说！
Bart: Whoa!
巴特：哇！
Mr. Burns: Trouble, Simpson?
伯恩斯先生：有麻烦吗，辛普森？
Homer: No. (chuckles) Just congratulating the son on a fine joke about his old man.
霍默：不。（笑）只是在称赞儿子讲了个关于他老爹的好笑话。
Homer: Now remember, as far as anyone knows, we’re a nice, normal family.
霍默：记住，就目前所知，我们是一家和和美美、正常的家庭。
Lisa: Hey, Bart, last one in the fountain’s a rotten egg!
丽莎：嘿，巴特，最后一个跳进喷泉的是个臭蛋！
Bart: Hey!
巴特：嘿！
Homer: D’oh! Be normal! Be normal!
霍默：哎哟！要正常！要正常！
Marge: What an adorable little girl.
玛姬：多么可爱的女孩啊。
Woman: (chuckles) Thank you. Why don’t we dump them in the nursery and get a glass of punch?
女士：（轻笑）谢谢。我们把她们先放到托儿所，去喝杯果汁怎么样？
Marge: Oh, I’m not much of a drinker.
玛姬：哦，我不太会喝酒。
Woman: Hey, isn’t that your boy there torturing the swans?
女人：嘿，那不是你家的男孩在折磨天鹅吗？
(squawking) （
嘎嘎叫）
Homer: Bart!
荷马：巴特！
Marge: (groans) Maybe I will take you up on that punch.
玛姬：（呻吟）也许我会接受你那一拳。
Marge: Gee, do you think we should leave the kids unsupervised?
玛姬：天呐，你觉得我们应该让孩子们无人看管吗？
Woman: You’re right. There.
女人：你说得对。就在那里。
Homer: Bart! Lisa! (mumbles)
霍默：巴特！丽莎！（含糊地说）
(squawking) （
尖叫声）
Homer: Where are you, kids? Oh!
霍默：孩子们，你们在哪儿？哦！
Bart: Whoops.
巴特：哎呀。
Homer: Got ya!
霍默：抓到你了！
Bart: Whoa, careful, Dad. Blow a gasket, you lose your job.
巴特：哇，小心点，老爸。如果发火了，你就会丢工作。
Smithers: Now hear this: The father/son sack race will begin in five minutes on the north lawn. Participation is mandatory. Repeat, mandatory. That is all.
史密瑟斯：请注意：父子麻袋赛将在五分钟后于北草坪开始。必须参加。重复，必须参加。以上。
Homer: You remember the rules from last year?
荷马：你还记得去年的规则吗？
Bart: Yeah. Shut my mouth, and let your boss win.
巴特：记得。闭上我的嘴，让你的老板赢。
(squawking) （
尖叫声）
Bart: Hey!
巴特：嘿！
Woman 2: I don’t know who to love more: my son, Joshua, who’s captain of the football team; or my daughter, Amber, who got the lead in the school play. Usually, I use their grades as a tiebreaker, but they both got straight A’s this term, so… what’s a mother to do?
女人 2：我不知道该更爱谁：我儿子乔书亚，他是足球队队长；还是我女儿安柏，她在校话剧中拿了主角。通常我会用他们的成绩来打破僵局，但这学期他们俩都拿了全优，所以……一个母亲该怎么办呢？
Marge: Mm-hmm. Well, I sense greatness in my family.
玛姬：嗯嗯。我感觉我家有非凡之处。
Woman: Your family?
女人：你家？
Marge: Well, it’s a greatness that others can’t see, but it’s there. And if it’s not true greatness we have, we’re at least average. I don’t want to alarm anyone, but I think there’s a little al-key-hol in this punch.
玛姬：嗯，这是一种别人看不见的非凡，但确实存在。如果不是真正的非凡，我们至少是平均水平。我不想惊动谁，但我觉得这杯果汁里有点酒精味。
Smithers: Mr. Burns, are you ready?
史密瑟斯：伯恩斯先生，您准备好了吗？
Mr. Burns: Yes.
伯恩斯先生：准备好了。
Smithers: Are you set?
史密瑟斯：您就绪了吗？
Mr. Burns: Yes.
伯恩斯先生：就绪。
Smithers: (whispering) Go, Mr. Burns.
史密瑟斯：（低声）走吧，伯恩斯先生。
Mr. Burns: (grunting)
伯恩斯先生：（咕哝）
(all cheering) （
众人欢呼）
(g*nsh*t) （
枪声）
Bart: Man, this is pathetic. I’m goin’ for it!
巴特：天哪，真可怜。我要冲了！
Homer: Bart, no! Oh, oh, oh. Oh, no, wait. Oh, no. Bart, don’t. Don’t. No!
霍默：巴特，不行！哦，哦，哦。哦，不，等等。哦，不。巴特，别。别。不要！
(all laughing, cheering)
（
众人笑声、欢呼）
Mr. Burns: Close one this year. (sinister laugh)
伯恩斯先生：今年真险。 （阴险地笑）
Marge: ♪ Here we sit enjoying the shade ♪
玛姬：♪ 我们坐在这里，享受着树荫 ♪
Women: ♪ Hey, brother, pour on the wine ♪
女人们：♪ 喂，兄弟，把酒倒上来 ♪
Marge: ♪ Drink the drink that I have made ♪
玛姬：♪ 喝我调制的这杯酒 ♪
Women: ♪ Hey, brother, pour on the wine ♪
女人们：♪ 喂，兄弟，把酒倒上来 ♪
Marge: ♪ He’s here at last my one and only ♪
玛姬：♪ 他终于来了，我独一无二的他 ♪
♪ Good-bye friends and don’t be lonely ♪
♪
再见了朋友们，别感到孤单 ♪
Women: ♪ Hey, brother, pour on the wine ♪ ♪
女人们：♪ 嘿，兄弟，倒上酒来 ♪ ♪
Homer: Marge, I need you!
荷马：玛姬，我需要你！
Marge: Hey, Homie! Did you try the punch?
玛姬：嘿，荷米！你尝过那杯饮料了吗？
Homer: Snap out of it, Marge. You’ve gotta come with me. The boss is going to make a toast.
荷马：清醒点，玛姬。你得跟我一起去。老板要来敬酒了。
Marge: Well, I’m not much of a drinker.
玛姬：哦，我不太喝酒。
Homer: Why you picked the perfect time to start. You…
荷马：你挑了个完美的时机开始。你……
♪ ♪ (“For He’s A Jolly Good Fellow” off-key)
♪ ♪（“
他是个快乐的小伙子” 唱跑调）
Mr. Burns: Musicians, cease that infernal tootling. Thank you all… uh, for coming.
伯恩斯先生：乐师们，别再吹那该死的长号了。谢谢你们……呃，感谢你们的到来。
(applause) （
掌声）
Homer: Marge, knock it off.
霍默：玛姬，别闹了。
Marge: (scoffs) Well, I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry.
玛姬：（嗤之以鼻）好吧，对不起。对不起。对不起。
Homer: Marge!
霍默：玛姬！
Mr. Burns: But now it’s time to say goodbye. Please, get off my property until next year. I suggest you don’t dawdle. The hounds will be released in ten minutes.
伯恩斯先生：但现在该说再见了。请在明年之前离开我的地产。我建议你别磨蹭。猎犬将在十分钟后放出。
(applause) （
掌声）
Man 2: Did you have a good time, son?
男子 2：你玩得开心吗，儿子？

Dr. Monroe: Homer, what have you got for us?
门罗博士：霍默，你给我们带来什么了？
Homer: (humming continues)
霍默：（继续哼唱）
Dr. Monroe: Homer?
门罗博士：霍默？
Homer: Oops, sorry. I wasn’t paying attention.
霍默：哎呀，抱歉。我没注意。
Dr. Monroe: Well, if you had been paying attention, perhaps you would have noticed that your family sees you as a rather stern authority figure, an ogre if you will.
门罗医生：嗯，要是你有注意，也许你就会发现，你的家人把你看作一个相当严厉的权威人物，可以说是个食人魔。
Marge: Now, Doctor, that’s not true.
玛姬：现在，医生，那可不是真的。
Lisa: Ogre is such a strong word.
丽莎：食人魔是个多么强烈的词啊。
Bart: Right on, Doc! Another successful diagnosis.
巴特：说得好，医生！又一次成功诊断。
Homer: That does it!
霍默：够了！
Dr. Monroe: Wow! (chuckles) Okay, you wanna k*ll each other. That’s good. That’s healthy. There’s nothing necessarily wrong with hostile conflict. All I ask is that you use my patented aggression therapy mallets.
门罗医生：哇！（笑）好，你们想要互相干掉对方。那不错。这很健康。敌对冲突并不一定有什么不对。我唯一的要求是，你们得用我专利的攻击疗法小木槌。
Homer: Good idea.
霍默：好主意。
Bart: All right.
巴特： 好的。
Marge: I don’t know.
玛姬： 我不知道。
Dr. Monroe: Okay. Let’s take another deep, cleansing breath.
门罗医生： 好。我们再来一次深而净化的呼吸。
Simpsons: (inhaling) (all grunting)
辛普森一家：（吸气）（全部喘气）
Homer: Wait a minute. These mallet things are padded with foam rubber. What’s the point?
荷默：等一下。这些木槌上的垫子是泡沫橡胶做的。有啥用？
Bart: They’d work much better without the padding, Doc.
巴特：医生，要是不垫着会好得多。
Dr. Monroe: No, no. That’s not true.
蒙罗博士：不，不。那不是真的。
Bart: (grunts)
巴特：（哼声）
Dr. Monroe: Ah!
蒙罗博士：啊！
Bart: See?
巴特：看到了吧？
Dr. Monroe: Give me that. Yes, well, that concludes this portion of our treatment.
门罗医生：把那个给我。嗯，这就结束了这一部分的治疗。
Marge: Are we cured yet?
玛姬：我们治好吗？
Dr. Monroe: (scoffs) Don’t be ridiculous. You will be cured, but it’s going to require somewhat more unorthodox methods.
门罗医生：（嗤之以鼻）别傻了。你们会被治好的，但需要一些相当非常规的方法。
Homer: Unortho what?
霍默：Unortho 什么？
Dr. Monroe: Don’t worry. I’ll have plenty of time to explain while I warm up the… electric generator.
门罗博士：别担心。我在把……发电机预热的时候会有充足的时间来解释的。
Dr. Monroe: Everyone comfy?
门罗博士：大家都舒服吗？
(chuckles) Good. Now, don’t touch any of those buttons in front of you for a very important reason, i.e., you are wired into the rest of your family. You have the ability to shock them, and they have the ability to shock—
（
笑）很好。现在，别碰你们面前的任何按钮，有一个非常重要的原因，也就是，你们和家人的其他人连在一起。你们可以给他们电击，他们也可以给——
(electronic buzz) （
电子嗡嗡声）
Homer: (screaming)
荷马：（尖叫）
Bart: Just testing.
巴特：只是测试。
Homer: Why you—
荷马：你这个——
Dr. Monroe: No, Homer, not yet.
蒙罗医生：不，霍默，还没。
Homer: Aw.
霍默：唉。
Dr. Monroe: You see, this is what is known as aversion therapy. When someone hurts you emotionally, you will hurt them physically. And gradually you will learn not to hurt each other at all. And won’t that be wonderful, Homer?
蒙罗医生：你看，这就是所谓的厌恶疗法。当有人在情感上伤害你时，你会在身体上伤害他们。渐渐地，你们就会学会互不伤害。那时候不是很美好吗，霍默？
Homer: Oh, yes, Doctor.
霍默：哦，是的，医生。
(buzzing) （
嗡嗡声）
Bart: Whoa!
巴特：哇！
(buzzing) （
嗡嗡声）
Lisa: Ah!
丽萨：啊！
Marge: Bart, how could you shock your little sister?
玛姬：巴特，你怎么能把你妹妹电到？
Bart: My finger slipped. (screams)
巴特：我的手滑了。（尖叫）
Lisa: So did mine.
丽莎：我也是。（同样尖叫）
(buzz) （
嗡鸣声）
Lisa: (screams)
丽莎：（尖叫）
Bart: (screams)
巴特：（尖叫）
Marge: Bart, Lisa, stop that.
玛姬：巴特，丽莎，别那样。
(buzzing) （
嗡嗡声）
(screaming, buzzing continue)
（
尖叫声，嗡嗡声继续）
Dr. Monroe: No, no. Now, wait a minute. Wait! Wait! Folks, if I could— This is not the way to get healthy!
门罗医生：不，不。现在，等一下。等！等！各位，如果我能——这可不是变健康的方式！
(screaming, buzzing continue)
（
尖叫声、嗡嗡声继续）
Dr. Monroe: No! You’ve got to understand something! (yelling)
蒙罗博士：不！你们得明白一点！（喊叫）
♪ ♪ (music distorts)
♪ ♪（
音乐失真）
Dr. Monroe: People, please!
蒙罗博士：各位，请！
(buzzing) （
嗡嗡声）
(all screaming) （
所有人尖叫）
Smithers: Boy. Someone’s really gobbling up the juice, sir.
史密瑟斯：哎呀。有人真是在大口大口地喝果汁，长官。
Mr. Burns: Excellent. Excellent. Perhaps this energy conservation fad is as dead as the dodo.
伯恩斯先生：太好了。太好了。也许这股节能的风潮已经像渡渡鸟一样死了。
(screaming, buzzing continue)
（
尖叫声、嗡嗡声持续）
Dr. Monroe: No, no!
门罗医生：不，不！
Receptionist: Dr. Monroe, your other patients have fled the building.
接待员：门罗医生，您的其他病人已经逃离大楼。
Dr. Monroe: Stop! Stop! You’re damaging the equipment.
门罗医生：停！停！你们在损坏设备。
(electronic sizzle, hum)
（
电子噼啪声，嗡嗡声）
Bart: Hey. Nice hair, mom.
巴特：嘿。妈妈，新发型不错。
Marge: Gee, I thought we were making real progress.
玛吉：哎，我还以为我们真的有进步呢。
Dr. Monroe: No, I’m sorry, you’re not! Please, you’ve just got to go.
门罗博士：不，很抱歉，你们没有！拜托，你们必须离开。
Homer: Wait a minute, Doc. Your TV commercial said, “Family bliss or double our money back.”
霍默：等一下，医生。你的电视广告说，“家庭幸福，否则双倍退款。”
Dr. Monroe: Oh, but that was just— All right. (whispers) Get the money.
德·门罗医生：哦，那只是— 好吧。（低声）拿钱。
Dr. Monroe: 20, 40, 60, 80, 100. 20, 40, 60, 80, 200. 20, 40, 60, 80, 300. 20, 40, 60, 80, 400. 20, 40, 60, 80, 500. Just go, and never tell anyone you were here!
德·门罗医生：20、40、60、80、100。20、40、60、80、200。20、40、60、80、300。20、40、60、80、400。20、40、60、80、500。快走，绝对别告诉任何人你来过这里！
Homer: Wow, 500 smackers.
霍默：哇，五百块大洋。
Marge: Homer, how wonderful, our first pleasant surprise.
玛姬：荷马，多么美好，我们的第一个愉快惊喜。
Lisa: It’s not the money, as much as the feeling that we earned it.
丽莎：并不是钱，更多是那种我们靠自己挣来的感觉。
Bart: You did it, Dad.
巴特：你成功了，爸爸。
Marge: Excuse me, dear. Shouldn’t we be heading down to the pawn shop to get our TV back?
玛姬：抱歉，亲爱的。我们是不是该下去当铺把电视取回来？
Homer: That piece of junk? Forget it. We’re gonna get a new TV. Twenty-one-inch screen, realistic flesh tones, and a little cart so we can wheel it into the dining room on holidays.
荷马：那破烂？别想了。我们要买台新电视。二十一英寸屏幕，逼真的肤色，还有个小推车，这样节假日我们就能把它推到餐厅去。
Bart & Lisa: Yay!
巴特与莉萨：耶！
Marge: Oh, Homer, we love you.
玛姬：哦，荷马，我们爱你。

The-Simpsons/S01/01x05---Bart-the-Genera.title: 01x05 - Bart the General
The-Simpsons/S01/01x05---Bart-the-Genera.content:
01x05 - 小巴特将军
Inside, HOMER opens an oven.
在里面，霍默打开了烤箱。
HOMER: Do I smell cupcakes? Ooh, do I ever!
霍默：我闻到纸杯蛋糕的味道了吗？哦，太棒了！
MARGE: Uh-uh, Homer. Lisa’s making these for her teacher.
玛姬：不行，霍默。丽莎是给她老师做这些的。
HOMER: Ah. Say no more.
荷默：啊。别说了。
He closes it and seconds later Bart opens it.
他关上了，几秒钟后巴特又打开了。
BART: Yum! Don’t mind if I do!
巴特：好吃！那我就不客气了！
HOMER: Bart!
荷默：巴特！
Homer drags him back into the kitchen.
霍默把他拽回厨房。
BART: Oh, man!
巴特：哦，天哪！
LISA: Keep your greasy mitts outta there.
莉萨：别把你那油乎乎的爪子伸进去。
MARGE: These are for Lisa’s class.
玛姬：这些是给莉萨班上的。
LISA: It’s Mrs. Hoover’s birthday.
丽萨：今天是胡佛太太的生日。
BART: You know, there are names for people like you.
巴特：你知道吗，像你这样的人有专门的称呼。
LISA: No, there aren’t.
丽萨：没有的。
BART: Teacher’s pet, apple polisher, butt kisser—
巴特：老师的宠儿、献殷勤的人、拍马屁的家伙——
HOMER: Bart! You’re saying “butt kisser” like it’s a bad thing.
霍默：巴特！你把“拍马屁的人”说得好像那是件坏事。
BART: Huh?
巴特：嗯？
Homer taps his jeans and Bart moves to sit on his lap.
霍默拍了拍他的牛仔裤，巴特挪过去坐到他腿上。
HOMER: Well, you see, boy, it never hurts to grease the wheels a little.
霍默：你看，孩子，事事靠点油水总是有好处的。
LISA: I’m not greasing the wheels, Dad. I like my teacher.
丽莎：我不是在走后门，爸。我喜欢我的老师。
HOMER: Sure, Lis. You see how it works, Bart? A cupcake here, a good grade here.
荷马：当然了，莉斯。你看明白了吧，巴特？这里一个杯子蛋糕，那里一张好成绩。
LISA: Dad, I get good grades ‘cause I’m smart and I pay attention and I study hard.
丽莎：爸，我考得好是因为我聪明、我专心、我用功学习。
HOMER: Yeah right, Lisa. It’s the three roads to success, Bart: work, brains, and hmm—
荷马：是啊，莉莎。成功的三条路，巴特：努力、聪明，嗯——
He lifts up a cupcake.
他举起一个纸杯蛋糕。
LISA: Oh, brother.
丽莎：哦，天哪。
There is a loud honking outside.
外面传来一阵响亮的按喇叭声。
BART: Uh-oh, school bus! Gotta go.
巴特：哎呀，校车来了！得走了。
HOMER: Heh-heh-heh.
荷默：呵呵呵。
As he is about to shove the cupcake into his mouth, Lisa reaches over and grabs it from him.
就在他要把纸杯蛋糕塞进嘴里的时候，丽莎伸手把它从他那儿抢了过来。
HOMER: Doh!
荷默：哎呀！
CUT TO:
切换到：
Bart and Lisa make their way onto the bus. OTTO listens to music.
巴特和莉萨上了校车。奥托在听音乐。
BART: Yo, Ottoman!
巴特：喂，奥托曼！
OTTO: Yo, Bartdude!
奥托：喂，巴特小子！
BART: Hey, can you believe it man? My sister here made a whole pile of cupcakes to butter up her teacher, and she won’t give anybody else even one measly little crumb.
巴特：嘿，你能信吗，伙计？我妹妹为了讨老师欢心做了一大堆纸杯蛋糕，可她连一小块渣渣都不愿意分给别人。
OTTO: Huh, that’s bad news, man.
奥托：哎，这可不是好消息，伙计。
LISA: Here, Otto. I made an extra one for you.
丽莎：给你，奥托。我多做了一个给你。
OTTO: Oh, thanks, little lady.
奥托：哦，谢谢你，小姑娘。
LISA: You’re welcome.
丽莎：不客气。
Bart and Lisa sit together in one seat. The engine rumbles and everybody jumps around.
巴特和丽莎挤在一个座位上。引擎轰鸣，大家都晃动起来。
STUDENTS: Whoa!
学生们：哇！
BART: Better let me hold these, Lis.
巴特：让我来抱这些，丽丝。
He grabs for the box of cupcakes.
他抓向那盒纸杯蛋糕。
LISA: Forger it.
莉萨：别管它了。
She snatches it back.
她把它夺了回来。
BART: You sniveling toad! You little egg sucker!
巴特：你这个卑鄙的癞蛤蟆！你这小蛋吸虫！
LISA: Tell me more.
莉萨：继续说。
BART: Back-scratcher! Foot-licker! Honor student!
巴特：背部抓挠者！脚舐者！优等生！
LISA: You’ll never get one now, Mr. Name-caller.
丽萨：你现在再也得不到一只了，爱叫名字的人先生。
BART: All, all right. Look, I’m sorry. I got upset. In the heat of the moment, I said some things I didn’t mean.
巴特：好，好吧。听着，对不起。我冲动了。一时激动，说了些不该说的话。
LISA: You weren’t thinking, were you?
丽萨：你当时没多想，是吧？
BART: No.
巴特：不。
LISA: I’m not a sniveling toad, am I?
丽萨：我不是个爱哭的小蟾蜍，对吧？
BART: Not really.
巴特：不完全是。
LISA: I’m not a little egg sucker, am I?
丽萨：我不是个讨厌的小吸蛋怪，对吧？
BART: Of course not.
巴特：当然不是。
LISA: Then what am I?
丽莎：那我是什么？
BART: A beautiful human being.
巴特：一个美丽的人类。
LISA: What do you like best about me?
丽莎：你最喜欢我什么？
BART: Well, I’d have to say your generous nature, your spirit of giving.
巴特：嗯，我得说是你那慷慨的天性，你那乐于奉献的精神。
LISA: Well, open your mouth and close your eyes, and you will get a big surprise.
莉萨：好了，张开嘴，闭上眼睛，你会得到一个大惊喜。
Bart does as instructed. As he does, Lisa moves quickly from her seat. She drops a cupcake and then grabs it from the floor. She pushes it into Bart’s mouth.
巴特按指示去做。正当他照做时，莉萨迅速从座位上站起。她掉了一个纸杯蛋糕，然后从地上捡起来。她把它塞进巴特的嘴里。
BART: Thanks, Lis. You’re the best.
巴特：谢谢你，莉斯。你是最棒的。
DISSOLVE TO:
淡出至：
The front yard of school, where students talk. Lisa talks with her friend JANEY.
学校前院，学生们在说话。丽莎和她的朋友珍妮交谈。
LISA: Look, Janey, cupcakes.
丽莎：看，珍妮，纸杯蛋糕。
As she hands over the box, a BULLY comes in and snatches it up.
当她把盒子递过去时，一个恶霸走过来，一把抢走了。
BULLY: Ah, give me that!
恶霸：啊，把那个给我！
LISA: Hey, give those back!
丽莎：嘿，把那些还回来！
The bully takes a bite out of every cupcake and throws them away. Bart runs over, his fist high in the air.
恶霸把每个纸杯蛋糕咬了一口然后扔掉。巴特冲过来，拳头高举在空中。
BART: Hey, what’s the big idea? That’s my sister, man.
巴特：嘿，什么意思啊？那是我妹妹，伙计。
BULLY: So what?
混混：那又怎样？
BART: So give her back those cupcakes before I knock your block off.
巴特：把这些纸杯蛋糕还给她，否则我就揍扁你。
LISA: Don’t, Bart! He’s a friend of Nelson Muntz!
丽萨：别，巴特！他是纳尔逊·芒茨的朋友！
The bully drops the box of cupcakes and stomps on it. Bart and the bully lock eyes.
混混把装蛋糕的盒子扔下踩碎了。巴特和混混对视着。
BART: Ooh!
巴特：哦！
He leaps into the air and brings the bully down to the ground. They fight before a hand reaches and takes Bart off. The hand of NELSON MUNTZ. Bart swings blindly in all directions.
他跳到空中，把恶霸摔到地上。他们扭打在一起，这时一只手伸过来把巴特抱走。是纳尔森·芒茨的手。巴特盲目地向四周挥拳。
BART: Ah-ah-ah-ah-ah!
巴特：啊—啊—啊—啊—啊！
Nelson throws Bart to the ground.
纳尔森把巴特摔到地上。
BART: Wha?
巴特：什么？
BULLY: Nelson, you’re bleeding!
恶霸：纳尔逊，你在流血！
A small trickle of b lood comes out of Nelson’s nose.
纳尔逊的鼻子流出一小股血。
NELSON: Nah, happens all the time. Somebody else’s blood splatters on me. Hey, wait a minute. You’re right! You made me bleed my own blood!
纳尔逊：不，常有的事。别人的血溅到我身上。哎，等等，你说得对！你让我流出我自己的血！
The students gasp.
学生们倒吸一口冷气。
BART: It was an accident, man. A terrible, ghastly mistake. Ask anybody.
巴特：这是意外，伙计。一个可怕、骇人的错误。问问任何人。
The wind blows. Everyone is silent.
风吹过。所有人都沉默。
BART: Uh-oh. A cold wind.
巴特：哦哦。一阵冷风。
PRINCIPAL SKINNER suddenly arrives.
史金纳校长突然出现。
SKINNER: Hello kids, everything above the board here? Good, play friendly, children.
史金纳：孩子们好，大家都在黑板上方吗？很好，友好地玩，孩子们。
The bell rings.
钟声响起。
SKINNER: Uh-oh, there’s your bell. Come along, now, all of you. No dawdling, now.
史金纳：哦哦，钟来了。快点，现在，你们都跟上。别磨蹭。
NELSON: I’ll get you after school, man.
纳尔逊：放学后我会找你算账的，伙计。
BART: But—
巴特：可是——
SKINNER: Oh, no, no, no. He’ll get you after school, son. Now, hurry up. It’s time for class.
斯金纳：哦，不，不，不。他会放学后找你，孩子。现在，快点，课堂时间到了。
BART: But—
巴特：可是——
SKINNER: Scoot, young Simpson. There’s learning afoot.
斯金纳：走开，小辛普森。要上课了。
Bart slowly walks into the school.
巴特慢慢走进学校。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解为：
A classroom. Various students have their books open. Bart sits thinking.
一间教室。各个学生都打开了书。巴特坐着沉思。
DISSOLVE TO:
溶解转场到：
Bart’s dream. Bart stands, his fists in front of him on the playground.
巴特的梦境。巴特站着，双拳握在面前，位于游乐场。
BART: Okay, Nelson, put up your dukes!
巴特：好吧，纳尔逊，上手吧！
A big shadow looms over Bart.
一道巨大的阴影笼罩在巴特身上。
BART: Aaa!
巴特：啊啊！
He runs away and goes through a school door. Seconds later, the door is punched through by a big hand.
他跑开并钻进一扇学校的门。几秒钟后，一只大手把门捅开。
It falls and Nelson arrives.
门倒了，纳尔逊出现了。
BART: Yikes!
巴特：哎呀！
Bart runs to a crate of knives. He picks them up by the handful and throws them into Nelson.
巴特跑向一箱刀子。他一把把它们抓起，朝纳尔逊扔去。
BART: Ah ah ah!
巴特：啊啊啊！
They all land in Nelson’s chest. He is unaffected. He takes them all out.
刀子全部插在纳尔逊的胸口。他毫发无损。他把它们全都拔出来。

学生们欢呼，我们——
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解为：
In front of the Simpsons household. Nelson is still in the same position.
在辛普森家门前。纳尔逊仍保持着同样的姿势。
BART: I guess you learned your lesson, so now I’ll untie you.
巴特：我想你已经吸取教训了，所以我现在要把你绑着的绳子解开。
NELSON: The second you untie me, I’m gonna beat you to death, man.
尼尔森：你一把我解开绳子，我就把你打死，伙计。
BART: Well, if that’s gonna be your attitude, I’m not gonna untie you.
巴特：好吧，如果你都这样，那我就不把你解开。
NELSON: Ha, you’re gonna have to sometime.
尼尔森：哈，总得有一次吧。
BART: Uh-oh. He’s right.
巴特：哦哦，他说得对。
Herman comes in.
赫尔曼进来了。
HERMAN: Don’t you worry, I was ready for this little eventuality.
赫尔曼：别担心，我早已为这种小意外做好准备。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解至：
Homer, Lisa, and Maggie watch TV in the living room. Nelson sits tied up on the couch near them.
霍默、莉莎和玛姬在客厅看电视。尼尔森被绑着坐在他们附近的沙发上。
Nearby on a table, Herman, Abe, and Bart look over a paper.
在旁边的一张桌子上，赫尔曼、艾伯和巴特在看一份文件。
HERMAN: Armistice treaty, article four. “Nelson is never again to raise his fists in anger.” Article five. “Nelson recognizes Bart’s right to exist.” Article six. “Although Nelson shall have no official power, he shall remain a figurehead of menace in the neighborhood.”
赫尔曼：停战条约，第四条。“纳尔逊不得再以愤怒扬起拳头。”第五条。“纳尔逊承认巴特的生存权。”第六条。“尽管纳尔逊将不再具有正式权力，但他应继续作为街区的威慑象征存在。”
BART: Wow, sounds good to me. Okay, I’ll sign.
巴特：哇，听起来不错。我签。
HOMER: What about you, boy?
荷马：你呢，孩子？
NELSON: All right, I’ll sign.
纳尔逊：好吧，我签字。
MARGE: Are boys through playing w*r?
玛姬：男孩子们都不再打架了吗？
BART: Yeah.
巴特：是的。
NELSON: Yes, Mrs. Simpson.
纳尔逊：是的，辛普森太太。
MARGE: Good! Then here’s some cupcakes.
玛姬：好！那这些纸杯蛋糕给你们。
BART: Oh, boy!
巴特：哦，太棒了！
The entire family (plus Herman) all snatch one.
全家（外加赫尔曼）都抢了一个。
HOMER: Cupcakes!
荷马：纸杯蛋糕！
They eat in good cheer…
他们兴高采烈地吃着……
DISSOLVE TO:
溶灭切换至：
A library, with several shelves loaded with books. Bart sits on a table, a pile of books around him as well.
一个图书馆，几排书架上摆满了书。巴特坐在一张桌子上，周围堆着一摞摞书。
He speaks to us.
他对着我们说话。
BART: Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, contrary to what you’ve just seen, w*r is neither glamorous nor fun. There are no winners, only losers. There are no good wars, with the following exceptions: The American Revolution, World w*r II, and the Star Wars trilogy. If you’d like to learn more about w*r, there’s lots of books in your local library --- many of them with cool, gory pictures. Well, good night, everybody. Peace, man.
巴特：女士们、先生们，男孩们、女孩们，与刚才你们所见相反，战*争既不光鲜也不好玩。没有赢家，只有输家。没有“正义的”战争，但有以下例外：美国独立战争、第二次世界大战，以及《星球大战》三部曲。如果你想了解更多关于战*争的知识，你当地图书馆有很多书——许多书里都有酷炫、血腥的图片。好了，大家晚安。和平，兄弟。
FADE OUT [Patton theme plays once again]
画面淡出（《巴顿将军》主题曲再次响起）
A random night shot of the Simpsons house as credits begin.
随着片尾字幕开始，辛普森一家房子的一个随机夜景镜头。
FADE OUT
画面淡出
THE END
结束

The-Simpsons/S01/01x06---Moaning-Lisa.title: 01x06 - Moaning Lisa
The-Simpsons/S01/01x06---Moaning-Lisa.content:
哀怨的丽莎
FADE IN:
淡入：
We open on a sad shot of LISA’s face. She is standing on a stool staring into the mirror in her bathroom as a faucet drips nearby. The door is banged on several times. Lisa sighs.
我们以丽莎那张悲伤的面孔开场。她站在凳子上凝视着浴室里的镜子，附近的水龙头滴答作响。有人在门上敲了好几下。丽莎叹了口气。
OUTSIDE, HOMER bangs angrily on the door.
外面，荷马愤怒地在门上敲打。
HOMER: Lisa! Lisa, are you still in there? What’s the problem? Did you fall in? (chuckles) (angrily) Lisa!
荷默：丽莎！丽莎，你还在里面吗？怎么了？你是不是掉进去了？（轻笑）（生气地）丽莎！
Lisa finally opens the door and steps out but before Homer can enter, BART runs past him.
丽莎终于打开门走了出来，但在荷默进门之前，巴特从他身边冲了过去。
BART: Sorry, Dad. Women and children first.
巴特：抱歉，老爸。妇女和儿童优先。
HOMER: What the---!?
荷默：什么——！？
Bart locks the door on him and Homer continues banging. Lisa stares at the scene.
巴特把门锁上了，荷马继续猛敲。丽莎盯着这一幕。
FADE TO BLACK
淡出至黑
QUICK FADE IN
迅速淡入
The kitchen, a bit later. Bart eats cereal while Marge washes dishes. Homer suddenly runs in.
厨房，过了一会儿。巴特一边吃麦片，一边玛姬洗碗。荷马突然跑进来。
HOMER: Where the hell are my keys? Who stole my keys? Come on, I’m late for work!
荷马：我的钥匙到底在哪儿？谁偷了我的钥匙？拜托，我上班要迟到了！
MARGE: Oh, Homer, you’d lose your head if it weren’t securely fastened to your neck.
玛姬：哦，霍默，如果你的脑袋没牢牢拴在脖子上，你早就丢了。
BART: Did you check the den?
巴特：你检查过书房了吗？
HOMER: The den! Great idea.
霍默：书房！好主意。
Bart follows Homer as he searches inside a couch. Various objects like eaten apple cores and pencils fall out.
巴特跟着霍默一起在沙发里搜寻。各种物品像被啃过的苹果芯和铅笔掉了出来。
BART: Warm. No, cold. Colder, ice cold.
巴特：温的。不，冷的。更冷，冰冷的。
HOMER: Do you know where my keys are?
霍默：你知道我的钥匙在哪吗？
BART: No, I’m talking about your breakfast.
巴特：不，我在说你的早餐。
Bart laughs as Homer growls and raises his hands to strike.
巴特大笑，霍默咆哮着举起手要打人。
BART: Did you try the rumpus room?
巴特：你试过闹腾室了吗？
HOMER: Rumpus room? Great idea.
霍默：闹腾室？好主意。
As he runs past the front door, he spots Lisa.
当他跑过前门时，他看见了莉萨。
LISA: Oh, Dad.
莉萨：哦，爸爸。
HOMER: Huh?
荷默：嗯？
She points. The keys are still in the door lock.
她指着。钥匙还插在门锁里。
HOMER: D-oh!
荷默：哎——哦！
BART: Oh, Homer!
巴特：哦，荷默！
LISA: Here.
莉萨：给你。
Marge suddenly runs in.
玛姬突然跑了进来。
MARGE: I’m sorry, everybody but I’ve only got two cupcakes for the three of you.
玛姬：对不起，大家，但我只有两个纸杯蛋糕，给你们三个。
BART: Well, Mom, one of us has scarfed down more than enough cupcakes over the past three decades to keep a ---
巴特：嗯，妈妈，我们中有一个人在过去三十年里吃了足够多的纸杯蛋糕，足以……
HOMER: Bart!
荷马：巴特！
LISA: Just take mine. A simple cupcake will bring me no pleasure.
丽莎：拿我的吧。一个普通的杯形蛋糕带不来我的快乐。
She walks out of the room. Homer and Bart are confused for a second, then—
她走出房间。荷马和巴特愣了一秒，然后——
BART: Ho ho, yeah!
巴特：嘿嘿，耶！
HOMER: All right.
荷马：好吧。
They high five each other.
他们互相击掌。
FADE TO BLACK
淡出至黑
QUICK FADE IN:
快速淡入：
The music class inside school. MR. LARGO, the teacher, conducts the class.
学校里的音乐课。拉戈先生，教师，正在上课。
MR. LARGO: All right, class. From the top. One, and two, and three, and—
拉尔戈先生：好，班上同学们。从头来。一起，一二三，和——
The class plays a tune.
全班演奏一段曲子。
MR. LARGO: My country, ‘tis of thee la da da da da dee…
拉尔戈先生：我的祖国啊，啦达达达达滴——
Everybody finishes playing but Lisa continues a different tune on her saxophone. Mr. Largo taps his stand several times with a stick.
大家都演奏完了，但丽莎用她的萨克斯风继续演奏着另一首曲子。拉尔戈先生用指挥棒在谱架上敲了好几下。
MR. LARGO: Lisa! Lisa Simpson!
拉尔戈先生：丽莎！丽莎·辛普森！
She finally stops.
她终于停下来了。
MR. LARGO: Lisa, there’s no room for crazy bebop in “My Country ‘Tis of Thee.”
拉尔戈先生：丽莎，“我美丽的祖国”里没有疯狂比博的空间。
LISA: But Mr. Largo, that’s what my country’s all about.
丽莎：可是拉尔戈先生，那正是我的国家的全部意义。
MR. LARGO: What?
拉尔戈先生：什么？
LISA: I’m wailing out for the homeless family living out of its car. The Iowa farmer whose land has been taken away by unfeeling bureaucrats. The West Virginia coal miner, coughing up---
丽莎：我在为无家可归、住在车里的那家人悲鸣。为被冷酷官僚夺走土地的爱荷华农夫悲鸣。为西弗吉尼亚的煤矿工人悲鸣，他咳嗽得——
MR. LARGO: Well, that’s all fine and good but, Lisa, none of those unpleasant people are going to be at the recital next week. Now, class. From the top. Five, six, seven…
拉尔戈先生：好吧，这些都说得挺好，但丽莎，那些不愉快的人下周都不会来参加演奏会。好了，大家。从头开始。五、六、七——
The entire class plays again, including Lisa. It is obvious, however, that she is not enthusiastic about it.
整个班级又开始演奏，包括丽莎。然而很明显，她并不热衷于此。
DISSOLVE TO:
转场溶解：
The lunchroom. A plate of food sits in front of Lisa but she doesn’t eat it. Her friend sits nearby.
食堂。丽莎面前放着一盘食物，但她没有吃。她的朋友坐在附近。
LISA: Every day at noon a bell rings, and they herd us in here for feeding time. And we sit around like cattle, chewing our cuds, dreading the inevitable…
丽莎：每天中午钟一响，他们就把我们赶到这里来吃饭。我们像牲畜一样围坐着，反刍着，惧怕着那不可避免的……
BART: Ha ha! Food fight!
巴特：哈哈！打饭斗！
Food starts flying in all directions.
食物开始朝四面八方飞去。
LISA’S FRIEND: Come on, Lis! What are you waiting for? Chuck that spaghetti.
丽莎的朋友：快点，丽！你还等什么？把那盘意大利面扔了。
LISA: I choose not to participate.
丽莎：我选择不参与。
Everybody is running crazily around the lunch room now, throwing food. A glop of something hits Lisa and she grunts.
现在每个人都在午餐室里疯狂奔跑，扔着食物。一团不明物体砸到丽莎，她发出一声闷哼。
DISSOLVE TO:
淡出至：
In gym class, where LIsa stands in the middle of the court. A bunch of red dodgeballs hit her in the face. The GYM TEACHER looks angrily at her.
在体育课上，丽莎站在球场中央。一堆红色躲避球打在她脸上。体育老师愤怒地看着她。
GYM TEACHER: Lisa, we are playing dodge ball here. The object of the game is to avoid the ball by weaving or ducking out of its path.
体育老师：丽莎，我们在玩躲避球。这个游戏的目标是通过穿插或弯腰躲开球的路线。
LISA: In other words, to dodge the ball.
丽莎：换句话说，就是躲球。
GYM TEACHER: Listen, missy, just tell me why you weren’t getting out of the way of those ba*ls.
体育老师：听着，小妮子，告诉我你为什么不躲那些球。
Lisa looks up into the teacher’s eyes.
丽萨抬头看着老师的眼睛。
LISA: I’m too sad.
丽萨：我太难过了。
GYM TEACHER: Too sad to play dodgeball? That’s ridiculous. Now, let’s seem some enthusiasm. Play ball!
体育老师：太难过以至于不能玩躲避球？那太荒唐了。来点劲头，开球！
The game starts up and the same pattern continues; about a dozen ba*ls just hit Lisa and she remains motionless.
游戏启动，情形如常；大约有十来个球刚好打到 Lisa 身上，她纹丝不动。
FADE TO BLACK
淡出至黑
QUICK FADE IN
快速淡入
The Simpsons living room. Homer and Bart play a video game.
辛普森家的客厅。Homer 和 Bart 在玩视频游戏。
HOMER: Come on, come on, let’s go.
HOMER：
快点，快点，走吧。
A title comes onto the TV: Super Slugfest. The video game shows two boxers and a ring announcer. Bart narrates the scene.
一个标题出现在电视上：超级拳王赛。视频游戏显示两个拳击手和一个擂台播报员。巴特为画面配音。
BART: In the red trunks, with a record of 48 wins and no losses, the undisputed champ of this house, Battling Bart Simpson! Whoopee, whoo! And in the lavender trunks, with a record of zero wins and 48 defeats--- oh, correction, humiliating defeats --- all of them by knockout…!
巴特：穿红色短裤，战绩 48 胜零负，本屋不容置疑的冠军，英勇作战的巴特·辛普森！耶，呼呼！而穿薰衣草色短裤的，战绩零胜 48 负——哦，改口，羞辱性的失败——全部都是被击倒取胜……！
HOMER: Must you do this every time?
荷马：你每次都非得这样吗？
BART: Homer “The Human Punching Bag” Simpson!
巴特：荷马 “人肉沙袋” 辛普森！
The match begins and Bart’s character quickly topples Homer’s boxer.
比赛开始，巴特操控的角色很快把荷马的拳击手打倒了。
HOMER: Doh! Stupid joystick!
荷马：哎哟！该死的操纵杆！
BART: Ho ho. Three seconds folks, a new record!
巴特：呵呵。三秒钟，大家，新纪录！
HOMER: Hey, no. I’m not down. I’m --- get up, you! Get off the mat.
荷马：喂，不。 我没有倒下。我是——起来，混蛋！从擂台上滚下去。
Homer’s character finally stands up.
荷马的性格终于站出来了。
HOMER: Okay, here we go.
荷马：好吧，上吧。
BART: Yo, chump, you back again?
巴特：嘿，笨蛋，你又回来了？
HOMER: Get outta the way! How come he’s not ducking?
荷马：让开！他怎么还不躲？
Bart’s boxer begins brutally smashing Homer’s boxer.
巴特的拳击手开始残忍地猛击荷马的拳击手。
HOMER: Wait a minute. I can’t get my --- Get out of the way, stupid!
霍默：等一下。我拿不住我的——走开，笨蛋！
MARGE: Homer?
玛姬：霍默？
HOMER: Not now, Marge! Get out of the corner!
霍默：现在别说话，玛姬！从角落里出来！
MARGE: But they sent a note from school.
玛姬：可是他们寄来一张学校的便条。
HOMER (to Bart): What did you do this time, you little hoodlum? Oops, get outta the way!
荷马（对巴特）：这次又是你干的吗，你这个小流氓？哎呀，闪开！
BART: I didn’t do it. Nobody saw me do it. There’s no way they can prove anything.
巴特：我没干。没人看到我做的。根本没办法证明什么。
MARGE: No, Bart, this note isn’t about you.
玛姬：不，巴特，这张便条不是关于你的。
BART: It isn’t? There must be some mistake.
巴特：不是？一定有什么错误。
Marge hands a sheet to Homer.
玛姬把一张纸递给霍默。
BART: Hey, you’re right. This note’s about Lisa.
巴特：嘿，你说得对。这张便条是关于丽莎的。
HOMER: Lisa?
霍默：丽莎？
At this time, Bart’s character finally wins the match. Lisa sighs.
此时，巴特的角色终于赢得了比赛。丽萨叹了口气。
FADE TO BLACK (COMMERCIAL BREAK):
画面淡出黑屏（商业广告时间）：
FADE IN:
画面淡入：
Homer reads the note.
霍默读着便条。
HOMER: Lisa refuses to play dodgeball because she is sad.
荷马：丽莎拒绝玩躲避球，因为她很难过。
He looks at Lisa.
他看着丽莎。
HOMER: Well, she doesn’t look sad. I don’t see any tears in her eyes.
荷马：嗯，她看起来并不难过。我没看到她眼里有泪。
LISA: It’s not that kind of sad. I’m sorry, Dad, but you wouldn’t understand.
丽莎：不是那种难过。对不起，爸爸，但你不会理解。
HOMER: Oh, sure I would, princess. I have feelings too. You know, like “My stomach hurts!” or “I’m going crazy!” Why don’t you climb up on Daddy’s knee and tell him about it?
荷默：哦，当然会的，公主。我也有感情。你知道的，比如“我肚子疼！”或者“我快疯了！”你为什么不爬到爸爸膝上跟他诉诉说呢？
Lisa sits on Homer’s lap.
丽萨坐在荷默的腿上。
LISA: I’m just wondering what’s the point? Would if make any difference at all if I never existed? How can we sleep at night when there’s so much suffering in the world?
丽萨：我只是在想，这到底有什么意义？如果我从未存在，会有什么不同吗？当世界上有这么多痛苦时，我们怎么能安心入睡？
HOMER: Well --- I --- uh --- Come on, Lisa. Ride the Homer horsey!
荷默：嗯——我——呃——来吧，丽萨。骑荷默小马！
He tosses it her up and down.
他把它朝她上上下下地抛。
HOMER: Giddyup! Whee!
霍默：快点！耶！
MARGE: Oh, Lisa, honey, why don’t we go upstairs and I’ll draw you a nice hot bath. That helps me when I feel sad.
玛姬：哦，丽莎，亲爱的，我们上楼去吧，我给你放个热水澡。当我难过的时候这会对我有帮助。
LISA: Sorry, Dad. I know you mean well.
丽莎：抱歉，爸爸。我知道你是好意。
HOMER: Thanks for knowing I mean well.
霍默：谢谢你知道我是一片好意。
BART: Gee, Homer, looks like you got yourself a real problem on your hands.
巴特：哎，霍默，看起来你自己惹上大麻烦了。
HOMER: Yeah, right. Uh, Bart, vacuum this floor.
霍默：是啊，没错。呃，巴特，把这地板吸尘。
BART: Hey, man, I didn’t do anything wrong!
巴特：喂，老子没做错什么！
HOMER: In times of trouble, you’ve got to go with what you know. Now, hop to it, boy!
荷马：遇到麻烦的时候，就得按你熟知的方法来。快，去干吧，孩子！
Bart begins vacuuming and mutters under her breath.
巴特开始用吸尘器吸东西，并在心里嘀咕。
BART: Thinks he some big stupid Homer. Oh, man. Oh, man. I’ll show him. He thinks he’s so big.
巴特：以为他是个了不起的大笨蛋荷马。哦，天哪。哦，天哪。我会让他看看。他以为他很了不起。
He sucks up a whole deck of cards and then walks to Lisa, who has arrived back into the room.
他把整副纸牌都吸了进去，然后走向回到房间的莉萨。
BART: Enjoy your bath?
巴特：洗得舒服吗？
LISA: No, not really.
莉萨：不，不太舒服。
BART: Oh, too bad. Well, I certainly had fun vacuuming. Maybe now I’ll get the pleasure of scrubbing your tub.
巴特：哦，可惜。嗯，我吸尘倒是挺开心的。也许现在我还能享受刷你浴缸的乐趣。

排队的小孩：厉害？你开玩笑吧？打了两千多场，他还在用他最开始的那块二十五美分硬币。
BOXING CHAMPION: Okay, who’s next?
拳击冠军：好，下一个是谁？
EVERY PERSON IN LINE: Me, me, me, me, me, me!
排队的每个人：我、我、我、我、我、我！
Homer stands above them.
荷马站在他们上方。
HOMER: No, me!
荷马：不，是我！
Homer walks over to the champion.
霍默走到冠军面前。
HOMER: Listen, can you teach me to fight like you do?
霍默：听着，你能教我像你那样打架吗？
BOXING CHAMPION: I don’t think so.
拳击冠军：我想不行。
HOMER: Oh, come on.
霍默：哦，拜托。
BOXING CHAMPION: I’ll tell you what. I’ll do it if you bark like a dog.
拳击冠军：我告诉你，我就做，前提是你得像狗一样叫。
HOMER: You little--- (barks).
霍默：你这小……（汪）。
BOXING CHAMPION (laughing): You got yourself a deal, Fido.
拳击冠军（笑着）：成交了，菲多。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Later in the night; everybody has left the arcade. Only Homer and the champion play and Homer is clearly very tired.
夜深了；所有人都离开了游乐厅。只剩霍默和冠军在玩，霍默明显很累。
BOXING CHAMPION: Well, looks like you’re all out of quarters, old man.
拳击冠军：嘿，看起来你的四分之一硬币都用光了，老家伙。
HOMER: That’s okay. With the tips you’ve given me, I’m gonna pound the tar out of…a certain little smarty-pants tonight.
荷马：没关系。凭你给我的那些建议，今晚我要好好揍……一个自以为是的小家伙。
Footsteps are suddenly heard and the champion’s mom arrives.
突然听到脚步声，冠军的妈妈出现了。
MOM: Howie! I thought I told you to stop wasting your money in this stupid place!
妈妈：霍伊！我还以为叫你别再这蠢地方浪费钱了！
BOXING CHAMPION: Sorry, Mom.
拳击冠军：对不起，妈妈。
MOM (to Homer): And you! A man of your age, you should be ashamed of yourself.
妈妈（对霍默）：还有你！你都这么大岁数了，真该感到羞愧。
HOMER: Ehh…excuse me, i think I hear my wife calling.
霍默：呃……抱歉，我好像听到我妻子在叫我。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Marge and Lisa drive in their station wagon. Marge looks over sadly at Lisa.
玛姬和莉萨开着他们的旅行车。玛姬忧郁地望着莉萨。
MARGE: Now, Lisa, listen to me. This is important. I want you to smile today.
MARGE：
莉萨，听我说。这很重要。我希望你今天要微笑。
LISA: But I don’t feel like smiling.
LISA：
可我不想笑。
MARGE: Well, it doesn’t matter how you feel inside, you know. It’s what shows up on the surface that counts. That’s what my mother taught me. Take all your bad feelings and push them down. All the way down, past your knees, until you’re almost walking on them. And then you’ll fit in, and you’ll be invited to parties and boys will like you, and happiness will follow.
MARGE：
嗯，你内心的感受不重要，知道吗？重要的是表面呈现出来的那一面。这是我妈妈教我的。把你所有不好的感觉都往下压。一直压到膝盖以下，几乎像是在它们上面行走。然后你就能融入大家，会被邀请参加聚会，男孩子也会喜欢你，幸福就会随之而来。
Lisa smiles.
莉萨微笑了。
MARGE: Oh, come on, you can do better than that.
玛姬：哦，得了，你能做得比那更好。
Lisa reveals a larger smile.
莉萨露出更大的笑容。
MARGE: Oh, that’s my girl.
玛姬：哦，那是我的姑娘。
LISA: I feel more popular already.
莉萨：我已经感觉更受欢迎了。
She makes her way out of the car and to the front entrance of the school, where two BOYS spot her.
她从车里走出来，走到学校正门，两个男孩看见了她。
BOY 1: Hey, nice smile.
男孩 1：嘿，笑得不错。
LISA: Thanks.
丽莎：谢谢。
BOY 2: Hey, what are you talkin’ to her for? She’s just gonna say somethin’ weird.
男孩 2：嘿，你跟她说什么啊？她只会说些奇怪的话。
LISA: Not me.
丽莎：不是我。
BOY 1: You know, I used to think you were some sort of brainiac but I guess you’re okay.
男孩 1：你知道吗，我曾以为你是个天才，不过看来你还行。
LISA: Uh-huh.
丽莎：嗯哼。
BOY 2: Hey, why don’t you come over to my house after practice? You could do my homework.
男孩 2：嘿，练习后来我家怎么样？你可以帮我做作业。
LISA: Ok.
丽莎：好。
MARGE: Hmm!
玛姬：嗯！
MR. LARGO: Five minutes, people, five minutes. Now, Miss Simpson, I hope we won’t have a repeat of yesterday’s outburst of unbridled creativity.
拉尔戈先生：五分钟，各位，五分钟。现在，辛普森小姐，我希望我们不会重演昨天那场无法无天的创意爆发。
LISA: No, sir.
丽莎：不会的，先生。
Marge grunts. She smashes the pedal, does a U-turn, and snatches Lisa back into the car.
玛姬咕哝一声。她踩下油门，掉头，把莉萨拉回车里。
LISA: Wow, mom!
莉萨：哇，妈妈！
MR. LARGO: Hmm, so that’s where she gets it.
拉尔戈先生：嗯，原来她是从那儿继承的。
Marge stops the car when they are further away from the school.
玛姬把车停在离学校更远的地方。
MARGE: Lisa, I apologize to you. I was wrong. I take it all back. Always be yourself. You wanna be sad, honey, be sad. We’ll ride it out with you. And when you get finished feeling sad, we’ll still be there.
玛姬：丽莎，我向你道歉。我错了。我收回所有的话。永远做你自己。宝贝，你想伤心就伤心吧，我们会陪着你一起度过。当你不再难过时，我们仍然会在这里。
Lisa inches over to hug Marge.
丽莎慢慢挪过去拥抱玛姬。
MARGE: From now on, let me do the smiling for both of us.
玛姬：从现在起，让我来为我们俩微笑。
LISA: Ok, Mom.
丽莎：好，妈妈。
MARGE: I said you could stop smiling, Lisa.
玛姬：我说过你可以别再傻笑了，丽莎。
A big grin is on Lisa’s face.
丽莎脸上露出大大的 grin。
LISA: I feel like smiling.
丽莎：我就是想笑。
They smile at each other.
他们互相对视着微笑。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
The living room, where Bart and Homer each have a controller in their hands. Homer has a wicked look on his face.
客厅，巴特和荷马各手持一个控制器。荷马脸上带着狡黠的表情。
BART: I’m gonna knock you out one more time, and that’s it. This is getting boring, man.
巴特：我再把你打趴一次，就到此为止。真烦人，伙计。
HOMER: Just try not to k*ll me too hard, son. (chuckles).
荷马：尽量别把我打得太惨，儿子。（笑）
The two fighters smash at each other.
两个战斗角色互相猛攻。
BART: Whoa!
巴特：哇！
HOMER: Kid, tonight’s not your night.
荷马：孩子，今晚不是你的夜晚。
BART: All right, man, you asked for it. No more Mr. Nice Guy.
巴特：好吧，伙计，这是你自找的。别再装好人了。
HOMER: Aha! Blocked it. Haha! You missed me.
荷马：啊哈！挡下了。哈哈！你没打到我。
They both grunt.
他们都发出咕哝声。
BART: Oh!
巴特：哦！
HOMER: Heh heh heh. I got you. Ooh. Don’t try that, I got you blocked.
荷马：呵呵呵。我抓到你了。噢。别试了，我已经挡住你了。
Homer’s character punches Bart’s character around the entire ring.
荷马的角色在整个擂台上把巴特的角色拳打脚踢。
HOMER: And the crowd is on its feet as Hurricane Homer moves in for the k*ll!
霍默：观众都站起来了，飓风霍默冲上前准备结束比赛！
MARGE: Boys, I’d like your attention, please.
玛姬：孩子们，请注意一下。
HOMER: Quiet, Marge! This is my moment. Bart “The Bloody Pulp” Simpson is on the ropes. He is hoping I’ll put him out of his misery. Well, you’re in luck, Bart. Here comes my right!
霍默：安静，玛姬！这是我的时刻。巴特“血肉糜烂”辛普森正被逼到绳角。他希望我能结束他的痛苦。好吧，巴特，你走运了。我的右拳来了！
Homer is about to beat Bart when---
霍默正要揍巴特，突然——
The TV shuts off. Marge shows the plug to Homer.
电视关了。玛姬把插头拿给荷马看。
HOMER: My game, my game! I could have beat the boy! Marge, how could you? I was so close.
荷马：我的游戏，我的游戏！我本来可以打败那个男孩的！玛姬，你怎么能这样？我差点就赢了。
MARGE: I’m sorry, but this is more important than that silly, loud game.
玛姬：对不起，但这比那愚蠢又吵的游戏重要得多。
BART: You’re right, Mom. I’d just like to use this occasion to announce my retirement, undefeated from the world of video boxing.
巴特：你说得对，妈妈。我想借此机会宣布我的退役——在电玩拳击界保持不败。
Homer sobs.
霍默抽泣。
MARGE: Oh, calm down, Homer. Lisa has an idea that she thinks would be fun for the whole family.
玛姬：哦，冷静点，霍默。莉萨有个主意，她认为对全家都会很有趣。
Homer moans.
霍默呻吟。
FADE TO BLACK
淡出至黑
QUICK FADE IN:
快速淡入：
The entire family is at the club. “Bleeding Gums” Murphy is on stage.
全家人都在俱乐部里。“流血牙龈”墨菲在台上。
“BLEEDING GUMS” MURPHY: This next song was written by a friend of mine, one of the great little ladies of jazz.
“
流血牙龈”墨菲：这首歌是我的一个朋友写的，她是爵士界的一位伟大的小女士。
Murphy lifts up his sunglasses in a motion to Lisa. Murphy and his band begin to play. The entire Simpson family taps along.
墨菲抬起太阳镜向丽莎示意。墨菲和他的乐队开始演奏。辛普森全家随着节拍轻敲。
“BLEEDING GUMS” MURPHY:“
流血牙龈”墨菲：
I got this bratty brother
我有个讨人厌的弟弟
He bugs me every day
他每天都烦我
And this mornin’ my own mother
而今天早上我亲生母亲
Gave my last cupcake away
把我最后一个纸杯蛋糕给了别人
My dad acts like he belongs, y’all…
我爸表现得好像他属于这里，伙计们…
He belongs in the zoo
他应该呆在动物园里
HOMER: What?!
霍默：什么？！
“BLEEDING GUMS” MURPHY: “
流血牙龈”墨菲：
I’m the saddest kid
我是最伤心的孩子
In grade number two
在二年级
Murphy peforms a solo as credits appear.
墨菲在片尾字幕出现时独自演奏独奏。
It continues to play as an outside shot of the club is shown. CREDITS continue until…
在俱乐部外景被展示时音乐继续播放。片尾字幕持续出现直到…
FADE OUT
画面淡出
THE END
结束

The-Simpsons/S01/01x07---The-Call-of-the.title: 01x07 - The Call of the Simpsons
The-Simpsons/S01/01x07---The-Call-of-the.content:
辛普森家的召唤
FADE IN:
淡入：
We begin outside the Simpsons house, where HOMER hums as he waters flowers.
我们从辛普森家外开始，荷默一边哼着歌一边给花浇水。
To the left of him, BART guides a lawnmower across the yard.
在他左边，巴特在院子里推着割草机。
BART: Man! Rusty old hunk of junk!
巴特：天哪！这破旧生锈的玩意儿！
The FLANDER’S SON (ROD OR TODD) honks to Bart from the yard over. He is driving his own lawnmower as he sips a drink.
弗兰德家的儿子（罗德或托德）在隔壁院子对着巴特按喇叭。他一边喝着饮料一边开着自己的割草机。
FLANDER’S SON: Howdy, Bart. Hot enough for you?
弗兰德的儿子：你好，巴特。够热吧？
BART (grumbling): Shut up, Flanders. Hey, Dad, how come we can’t get a decent mower like the Flanders have?
巴特（抱怨道）：闭嘴，弗兰德斯。嘿，爸爸，为什么我们不能像弗兰德斯那样有辆体面的割草机？
HOMER: Just be happy with what you’ve got, son. Don’t try to keep up with the Flanders.
霍默：儿子，对你已有的感到满足就好。别总想跟弗兰德斯攀比。
A horn honks and a large shadow looms over Homer and Bart. It is NED FLANDERS, driving a brand new trailer house / RV.
一声喇叭响起，一个巨大的身影在霍默和巴特头顶投下。是内德·弗兰德斯，开着一辆崭新的拖车屋/房车。
NED: How do you like my new wheels, Simpson?
NED：
辛普森，你觉得我的新车怎么样？
BART: Oh, wow, man! What an RV!
BART：
哇，老兄！真是一辆房车！
HOMER: Bart! I, uh, suppose it has various features.
HOMER：
巴特！我，呃，想它有各种功能。
NED: Oh, it’s got everything: microwave, dish washer, big screen TV, deep fryer and oh, see up there on the roof?
NED：
哦，它应有尽有：微波炉、洗碗机、大屏电视、油炸锅，哦，看那屋顶上？
Homer gasps. A shiny satellite dish rests on top.
霍默倒吸一口气。一只闪亮的卫星天线竖在上面。
HOMER: A satellite dish!
霍默：卫星天线！
NED: Yes, indeedly-doodly.
内德：是的，确实确确实实。
HOMER: But, uh, how can you afford something like this, Ned? I get your mail once in a while and you make only 27 dollars a week more than I do.
霍默：可是，呃，你怎么负担得起这种东西，内德？我偶尔会帮你拿邮件，你每周也只比我多赚 27 美元。
NED: Oh, it’s simple, Simpson. Credit!
奈德：哦，很简单，辛普森。赊账！
HOMER: Ooh, credit!
霍默：哦，赊账！
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
A sign that says: Bob’s RV Round-Up. Another sigh below that says: We’d rather make a friend…than a profit. Basically, it’s a whole lot filled with loads of RV’s. Homer, Bart, MARGE, LISA, and MAGGIE all walk alongside each other.
一个标牌写着：鲍勃的房车大集。下面另一行叹息写着：我们宁愿交个朋友……也不图利润。基本上，这是一个堆满了许多房车的场地。霍默、巴特、玛吉、丽莎和玛吉一起并肩走着。
HOMER: Ooh…aah!
霍默：哦……啊！
A SALESMAN looks at them from a booth.
一位推销员从一个摊位里看着他们。
SALESMAN: Thank you, God.
推销员：感谢上帝。
He greets them.
他向他们打招呼。
SALESMAN: May I help you?
推销员：我能帮您吗？
MARGE: We’re just browsing, thank you.
玛姬：我们只是随便看看，谢谢。
HOMER: I’d like to see your finest RV. Do you have something that’s better than the Land Behemoth?
荷默：我想看看你们最好的房车。有没有比“陆地巨兽”更好的？
SALESMAN: Yes, we do. That would be the Ultimate Behemoth.
销售员：有的。那就是“终极巨兽”。
HOMER: Where is it?
荷默：在哪儿？
SALESMAN: You are standing in its presence. Behold!
售货员：你们正站在它面前。瞧！
The Simpsons realize they are standing next to it. It is gigantic.
辛普森一家意识到他们正站在它旁边。它巨大无比。
BART: Oh, wow!
巴特：哇哦！
SALESMAN: Would you look at this thing? Man built this. It’s a vehicle.
售货员：看看这玩意儿？人造的。它是一辆交通工具。
BART: Does it have its own satellite dish, sir?
巴特：它有自己的卫星接收天线吗，先生？
SALESMAN: You can tell your son it has its own satellite. The VanStar One, launched last February, just for this thing, that’s all.
推销员：你可以告诉你儿子它有自己的卫星。VanStar One，去年二月刚发射的，就为这个东西，专门的。
BART: Whoa, man!
巴特：哇，老兄！
MARGE: I’m not sure that we can afford---
玛姬：我不确定我们买得起——
HOMER: Does it have a deep fryer?!
霍默：它有油炸锅吗？！
SALESMAN: It has four of them --- one for each part of the chicken.
推销员：它有四个——每个鸡的部位一个。
MARGE: I don’t think we can afford this, Homer.
玛琦：霍默，我想我们买不起这个。
SALESMAN: Let’s worry about that later. Come on. Let’s take a tour. Want to? Come on.
推销员：这些我们以后再担心。来吧。参观一下。想吗？走吧。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
The Simpsons and the salesman look inside the trailer. Everything is luxurious and well-designed.
辛普森一家和推销员走进拖车里。里面的一切都很豪华、设计精良。
BART: Ay, caramba!
巴特：哎呀，糟糕！
LISA: This is better than our house.
丽莎：这比我们的房子还好。
HOMER: Wait till Flanders gets a load of this.
荷马：等弗兰德斯看到这个他可得惊呆了。
MARGE (grumbles): Seems so expensive.
玛姬（嘟囔）：看起来好贵。
Homer honks the horn.
荷马按喇叭。
HOMER: Hey! How much is it?
荷马：喂！多少钱？
SALESMAN: You’re a man of your convict --- you just wanted to ask that and blurted it out, didn’t you?
售货员：你是个被囚犯支配的人——你只是想问这个，然后脱口而出了，对吧？
HOMER: Yeah, how much is it?
荷默：嗯，这要多少钱？
SALESMAN: Well, first of all, I want you to know I like your face.
推销员：首先，我得让你知道我喜欢你的长相。
HOMER: You do?
荷默：你喜欢？
SALESMAN: I really do. I’m not saying that. I mean it. You got color in there. You’re not Roman, are you?
推销员：真的。我不是随便说说。我是认真的。你脸色不错。你应该不是罗马人吧？
HOMER: No.
荷默：不行。
SALESMAN: Look like a god, sort of. Why don’t we step into the credit office, Zeus? (to rest of family). Hey, your dad’s gonna just go in here, work it out, and you’ll drive home in this!
推销员：看起来有点像个神。我们为什么不进信用部办办呢，宙斯？（对其他人）嘿，你们老爸就进去一会儿，弄定了，你们就开着这辆回家！
QUICK DISSOLVE TO:
快速溶解到：
The salesman and Homer sit on opposite sides of a desk and talk.
推销员和荷默坐在桌子两边交谈。
SALESMAN (laughs): I’m not gonna quote you a price till I check your credit rating. And let me --- I want to make myself clear on this. This is a formality. If you’re saying to me, “Bob, is this guy good for it?”, I say, “Yes.”. I don’t check this machine, but I don’t own the place, even though’s my name up there. Long story, but that doesn’t matter. I’m gonna have to run it through the computer.
售货员（笑着）：在我查你信用记录之前我可不会报个价。让我把话说清楚。这只是个形式。如果你跟我说，“鲍勃，这家伙可靠吗？”，我会说，“是的。”我不查这台机器，但这地方不是我开的，尽管上面有我的名字。长话短说，这不重要。我得把它输进电脑。
The salesman presses Enter and suddenly, a loud siren erupts.
售货员按下回车，突然一阵刺耳的警报响起。
HOMER: Is that a good siren? Am I approved?

荷马：啊哈！抓住他了！
The sapling and the noose fling up, sending the rabbit flying into the clouds and beyond. There is a thud far away.
幼苗和套索一弹， 把兔子弹飞到云层之外。远处传来一声重响。
HOMER: Okay, okay. This time I’ll just go into the bushes over there, make a lot of noise, and flush out a rabbit. And when he comes out, you step on him.
荷马：好，好。这次我就到那边的灌木丛里去，弄出很大的动静，把兔子赶出来。等他一出来，你踩住他。
BART: Right, Dad.
巴特：好，爸爸。
Homer walks into a bush. There is some chittering, then Homer screams, and he walks out with rabbits, squirrels, snakes, and raccoons all hanging on to different parts of his body.
霍默走进一丛灌木。传来一些吱吱声，然后霍默尖叫起来，他走出来时兔子、松鼠、蛇和浣熊等抓着他身体的不同部位。
HOMER: Oooh, get ‘em off me! Get ‘em off me!
霍默：噢，把它们从我身上弄走！把它们从我身上弄走！
He rolls around in front of Bart, who stands there doing nothing.
他在巴特面前打滚，巴特站在那里什么也不做。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
Another campground, where a family sits with their baby.
另一个露营地，一户人家带着他们的婴儿坐着。
MAN: Great camping trip, honey. Traveled 800 miles, haven’t even seen a squirrel yet.
男人：很棒的露营旅行，亲爱的。开了 800 英里，连一只松鼠都没看到。
WOMAN: Well, the ranger at the gate said we should watch out for bears.
女人：门口的护林员说我们要当心熊。
A bear hides in the bushes, starring at them.
一只熊躲在灌木丛中，盯着他们看。
MAN: Ooh, bears. (laughs).
男人：哦，熊。（笑）
WOMAN: Mm-hmm.
女：嗯哼。
MAN: Right, right. Let me show you how many bears there are around here. Uh, hello, bears! Um, come on. Have a donut! Oh, what the heck, have me! Come and get it!
男：对，对。让我给你看看这附近有多少只熊。呃，你们好，熊们！嗯，来吧。吃个甜甜圈！哦，算了，吃我吧！过来抓我啊！
WOMAN: All right, all right. You made your point.
女：好啦，好啦。你说到点子上了。
MAN: (laughs) (mocking) Bears.
男：（笑）（嘲弄地）熊。
The bear sneaks up behind them.
熊从他们身后悄悄靠近。
He steals a bottle from the baby and brings it back to Lisa, who waits in the cave. She begins drinking as he also brings a baby doll. Then, a toy. And a ball. And another toy. And cubes. And a light.
它从婴儿那儿偷走一瓶奶，然后带回给在洞里等待的丽莎。它开始喝奶，同时还带回了一个婴儿玩偶。接着是一个玩具。还有一个球。又一个玩具。还有积木。还有一盏灯。
Discover more
探索更多
Soon, it is night time and the bears all crowd around Lisa and her collection of goodies.
很快，夜幕降临，所有的熊都围在丽莎和她的宝物堆旁。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Simpson campground. An owl hoots as Marge and Lisa sit around a campfire.
辛普森露营地。猫头鹰呜呜叫着，玛姬和丽莎围着篝火坐着。
LISA: I hope Maggie and the boys are all right.
丽萨：我希望玛吉和男孩子们都没事。
MARGE: Oh, I’m sure they’re just fine. After all, we built a fire and we don’t know anything about nature. Imagine what your father, an experienced woodsman, has done.
玛姬：哦，我相信他们肯定没事。毕竟我们生了火，而我们对大自然一无所知。想想你爸爸，一个经验丰富的伐木工，会怎么做。
LISA: Yeah, I suppose so. Good night, Mom.
丽萨：是啊，我想也是。晚安，妈妈。
MARGE: Good night, dear.
玛姬：晚安，亲爱的。
They both lie down to sleep.
他们两个躺下睡觉。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
Homer and Bart in a similar position but without a campfire…or clothes. They are freezing.
荷马和巴特处于相似的姿势，但没有篝火……也没有衣服。他们冻得发抖。
BART (teeth chattering): G-G-Good n-n-night, D-D-Dad.
巴特（牙齿打颤）：晚、晚、晚安，爸、爸、爸爸。
A wolf howls in the background.
远处传来一声狼嚎。
HOMER: G-G-Good n-n-night, son. Sleep tight.
霍默：晚——晚——晚安，儿子。睡个好觉。
Their teeth chatter.
他们的牙齿在打颤。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
Maggie, sleeping in the embrace of one of the bears. She wakes up and covers herself with one of his arms.
玛吉在一只熊的怀里睡着。她醒来，用那只熊的一条胳膊把自己盖住。
FADE TO BLACK
淡出至黑
FADE IN:
画面淡入：
Morning. Bart and Homer emerge from a cluster of trees.
早上。巴特和霍默从一片树丛中走出来。
BART (groaning): Are we there yet?
巴特（呻吟）：我们到了吗？
HOMER: No!
霍默：没有！
BART: Are we ever gonna be there?
巴特：我们什么时候才能到？
HOMER: How would I know? Quit asking pointless---
霍默：我怎么会知道？别再问无聊的——
He gasps.
他喘着气。
HOMER: Bart, look!
霍默：巴特，看！
Homer spies several bees flying around a honeycomb.
霍默发现几只蜜蜂在蜂巢周围飞舞。
HOMER: Honey. Honey! We’re saved.
霍默：蜂蜜。蜂蜜！我们得救了。
BART: Uh, Homer. Bees?
巴特：呃，荷马。蜜蜂？
Homer attacks it, takes a slop of honey, and gobbles it up.
荷马攻击它，拿了一勺蜂蜜，塞进嘴里咕嘟咕嘟地吃掉。
BART: How is it?
巴特：味道怎么样？
HOMER: Tangy.
荷马：有点酸。
He spits out several bees and starts to choke. Then, he starts shouting gibberish.
他吐出好几只蜜蜂，开始窒息。然后，他开始大声胡言乱语。
BART: What?
巴特：什么？
Homer makes motions.
霍默做出手势。
BART: Oh, water? That-a-way, man.
巴特：哦，水？那边，伙计。
Homer runs off.
霍默跑了。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
A man filming a reindeer near a stream of muddy water. Suddenly, Homer emerges from the bushes and plunges himself into the water. The man yells. Homer advances towards him and the man runs away screaming. Homer stands still, sadly defeated.
一名男子正在拍摄溪边一只驯鹿，溪水泥泞。忽然，霍默从灌木丛中钻出，纵身跳入水中。那人喊叫。霍默朝他走去，那人尖叫着逃跑。霍默站在原地，沮丧而黯然。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
A TV special, titled BIGFOOT! (with a picture of Homer in mud)
一档电视特辑，标题为：大脚怪！（配有一张泥地里霍默的照片）
TV ANNOUNCER: Bigfoot. The legendary half-man, half-ape is no longer a legend. He’s very, very real. What you’re about to see is unedited video footage taken earlier today in the hills three miles southwest of Tenderfoot Gorge.
电视播报员：大脚怪。这个传说中的半人半猿不再只是传说。他非常，非常真实。你们即将看到的是今天早些时候在坦德福峡谷西南三英里处山丘上拍到的未剪辑录像。
The shaky camera shows Homer screaming (same scene).
摇晃的摄像机显示荷马在尖叫（同一场景）。
TV ANNOUNCER: Now, the naturalist who took these absolutely extraordinary pictures was most impressed with the creature’s uncivilized look, its foul language and, most of all, its indescribable stench. A popular supermarket tabloid has offered a reward of $5,000 of anyone who brings in the creature alive.
电视播音员：现在，拍下这些绝对非凡画面的博物学家对这种生物最深刻的印象是它那未经驯化的外表、粗俗的语言，最重要的是它难以形容的恶臭。一份大众超市小报悬赏五千美元，奖励任何能活捉该生物的人。
A standard tabloid is shown, but a modified picture of Homer.
显示一本普通的小报，但照片被改成荷马的。
TV ANNOUNCER: Naturally, we’ll have more on this story as soon as it develops. We now return you to the president’s address already in progress.
电视播音员：当然，这条新闻一有进展我们会继续报道。现在回到正在进行中的总统讲话。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Homer, still dirty, and Bart sit on a log.
霍默仍然满身污渍，和巴特坐在一根木头上。
FADE TO BLACK
淡出至黑
FADE IN:
画面淡入：
A group of people (a lot with cameras) gather around the entrance to the park, all mindlessly chattering. There are concession stands for such things as “Official Bigfoot Souveniers” and “Half-Man Half-Ape Burgers”.
一群人（很多人带着相机）聚集在公园入口处，喋喋不休地闲聊着。还有卖小吃的摊位，售卖诸如“官方大脚怪纪念品”和“半人半猿汉堡”等商品。
There’s even a photo op with a paper replica of Bigfoot.
甚至还有一个与纸制大脚怪合影的拍照点。
A tough-looking PARK RANGER talks with Lisa and Marge.
一个看起来很强悍的公园护林员正在和丽莎与玛姬交谈。
PARK RANGER: It looks as if you girls have been getting along all right but it’s a darn good thing we found you when we did. There’s something horrible roaming these woods.
护林员：看起来你们这些女孩相处得还算不错，但幸好我们及时找到了你们。这里的树林里有些可怕的东西在游荡。
MARGE: There is?
玛姬：有吗？
The ranger hands her a newspaper. The headline reads “Bigfoot Still at Large” with Homer’s picture.
护林员把一份报纸递给她。头版标题写着“巨人足迹仍在逃”，配的是荷马的照片。
MARGE: Why, that’s my husband!
玛姬：哎，那是我丈夫！
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
A new magazine flashing up. The headline reads “I married BIgfoot” with Homer and Marge on the cover.
一本新杂志闪现。头条写着“我嫁给了大脚怪”，封面是荷马和玛姬。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Marge, who gives a press conference to several reporters, all who shove their microphones into her face.
玛姬在向几位记者召开新闻发布会，所有人都把麦克风塞到她面前。
MARGE: His name isn’t Bigfoot. His name is Homer.
玛姬：他不叫大脚怪。他叫荷马。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
An updated newspaper. Headline: “Bigfoot’s Wife Pleads: “Call Him Homer!”.
一份更新的报纸。头条：“大脚怪的妻子恳求：‘叫他荷马！’”
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Back to the conference.
回到记者招待会。
FEMALE REPORTER: What does it eat?
女记者：它吃什么？
MARGE: I don’t understand. What’s this all about? Well, I suppose pork chops are his favorite.
玛姬：我不明白。这是怎么回事？嗯，我想猪排是它最喜欢的。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Newspaper. “The Bigfoot Diet: Pork Chops Aplenty”.
报纸。“大脚怪的饮食：猪排吃个够”。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Behind Marge, a group of bears arrive.
玛吉后面，一群熊走了过来。
MALE REPORTER: Hey, get those bears out of here. I’m trying to do an interview.
男记者：嘿，把那些熊赶走。我正要做个采访。
ASSISTANT: No bears! We’re taping! All bears off the set.
助理：不准有熊！我们在录影！所有熊离开布景。
The bears leave. Nobody notices Maggie riding on one of them.
熊们离开了。没人注意到玛吉正骑在其中一只熊身上。
MALE REPORTER: Okay. Now let’s get back to your, uh, husband. How would you describe your marital relations? Brutish?
男记者：好。现在回到你那位，呃，丈夫。你会如何描述你们的婚姻关系？粗暴吗？
MARGE: Is this going to be on TV?
玛姬：这会上电视吗？
MALE REPORTER: Coast to coast.
男记者：全国直播。
Marge groans.
玛姬呻吟。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
The tired Homer and Bart, still wading through endless trees.
疲惫的荷马和巴特，仍在无尽的树林中跋涉。
HOMER: Just a little further.
荷马：就快到啦。
BART: Are we there yet?
巴特：我们到了吗？
HOMER: Just a little further.
荷马：就快到啦。
BART: Are we there yet?
巴特：我们到了吗？
HOMER: Just a little further.
霍默：再过一小会儿。
BART: Are we there yet?
巴特：我们到了吗？
HOMER: Just a little further.
霍默：再过一小会儿。
Homer sniffs the air.
荷马嗅了嗅空气。
HOMER: Food!
荷马：有吃的！
He walks into the bear’s cave and is surprised to find a bear towering over them. Soon, the entire clan surrounds them.
他走进熊洞，惊讶地发现一只熊高高地站在他们面前。不久，整族熊把他们团团围住。
HOMER: Nice grizzlies.
荷马：好大的灰熊们。
They slowly back away…
他们慢慢后退……
HOMER: N-nice grizzlies. Nice grizzlies.
荷马：好——好可爱的灰熊。好可爱的灰熊。
BART: What do we do, Dad?
巴特：我们该怎么办，爸爸？
HOMER: Praise the grizzlies, son.
荷马：孩子，赞美这些灰熊。
BART + HOMER: Nice grizzlies. Nice grizzlies.
巴特 + 荷马：好大的灰熊。好大的灰熊。
HOMER: That’s a good grizzly.
荷马：那是一只好灰熊。
The bears growl. Bart starts to whimper when the sucking of a pacifier is heard. The bears turn around and see Maggie. Slowly, the bears back away.
熊发出低吼声。吸奶嘴的吮吸声响起，巴特开始抽噎。熊转过身看到玛吉。熊慢慢后退。
BART + HOMER: Huh?
巴特 + 荷马：哈？
HOMER: Maggie! Oh, my little girl.
荷默：玛吉！哦，我的小女孩。
He picks her up.
他抱起她。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
Homer and Maggie walk (well, walk and crawl) out of the cave. Homer slowly backs out, still saying “Nice grizzlies, nice grizzlies.”
荷默和玛吉（好吧，一个走一个爬）走出洞穴。荷默慢慢地向后退着，仍然说着“好灰熊，好灰熊”。
BART: Later, grizzly dudes.
巴特：回头见，灰熊伙计们。
Maggie looks back and sucks her pacifier. The bears stare in sadness. One has even got a pacifier in his mouth. Maggie waves and crawls away.
玛吉回头含住她的奶嘴。熊们伤心地盯着她看。其中一只甚至嘴里也含着奶嘴。玛吉挥手然后爬走。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
Bart and Maggie and Homer walk through a field when they hear chattering.
巴特、玛吉和荷马走过一片田地时，他们听到叽喳声。
BOY: Look! It’s him! It’s Bigfoot!
男孩：看！是他！是大脚怪！
VOICE: Get in the car. Get em. Get em.
声音：上车。抓住他。抓住他。
All the reporters and hunters rush towards him. They throw a net over Homer and bring him to the ground.
所有记者和猎人冲向他。他们把网扔在霍默身上，把他按倒在地。
BOY: We got him! We got Bigfoot!
男孩：我们抓到他了！我们抓到大脚怪了！
PARK RANGER: You are darn lucky we got here in time to rescue you.
公园护林员：你可真走运，我们及时赶到救了你。
BART: What the hell are you talking about, sir?
巴特：长官，你到底在说什么鬼话？
Homer grumbles and escapes from the net.
霍默咕哝着从网中逃脱。
CATCHER: He’s getting away! After him!
抓捕者：他要逃了！追上他！
CATCHER 2: We gotta take him alive. You got that tranquilizer g*n ready?
抓捕者 2：我们要活捉他。你准备好镇静剂枪了吗？
A woman loads a g*n with a dart and fires. It lands in Homer’s…um…backside. He shrieks and falls.
一名妇女给枪装上麻醉箭并开火。它射中了霍默的……嗯……后面。他尖叫着倒下。
BART: Dad! Oh, Dad!
巴特：爸爸！哦，爸爸！
HOMER: Avenge me, son. Avenge my death.
荷马：为我报仇，儿子。为我的死报仇。
Homer begins snoring.
荷马开始打鼾。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
A television program. Homer is kept in a glass cage.
一个电视节目。荷马被关在一个玻璃笼子里。
TV REPORTER: Last week’s capture of Bigfoot turned into the scientific poser of the century.
电视记者：上周抓到的大脚怪成了世纪性的科学难题。
Homer is handed a pork chop and he slops it down.
荷马接过一块猪排，大口吞了下去。
TV REPORTER: Although the creature was ultimately released, the question remains, “Who was this Homer?” Was it a man, or was it in fact the legendary missing link known as Bigfoot?
电视记者：虽然这只生物最终被释放，但问题依然存在：“这究竟是谁的荷马？”他是个人类，还是实际上就是传说中的失落环节——大脚怪？
HOMER: Could I have some applesauce?
荷马：能给我点苹果酱吗？
TV REPORTER: Specialists around the world gathered at the Springfield Primate Institute for a firsthand examination of the controversial creature. They are now ready to announce their findings.
电视记者：来自世界各地的专家聚集在春田灵长类研究所，亲自检查这一备受争议的生物。他们现在准备公布调查结果。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
The conference. Marvin (from a couple episodes ago) speaks to a room full of reporters.
会议上。马文（几集前出现过）对一屋子的记者发言。
MARVIN: Uh, ladies and gentlemen, uh, distinguished colleagues, after extensive biological and anatomical testing, I regret to announce that the evidence we have is inconclusive. This thing may or may not be human.
马文：呃，女士们，先生们，呃，尊敬的同事们，经过广泛的生物学和解剖学检测，我遗憾地宣布，我们掌握的证据并不确定。这个东西可能是人类，也可能不是。
The crowd chatters.
人群窃窃私语。
GERMAN SCIENTIST: That’s what he thinks. I say it’s none other than Bigfoot himself.
德国科学家：那是他那样想的。我说那不是别人，正是大脚怪本人。
FRENCH SCIENTIST: Oh, no, I disagree. I think it is a man. The eyes have the glimmer of human intelligence.
法国科学家：哦不，我不同意。我认为那是个人。眼睛里有着人类智慧的光芒。
RANDOM SCIENTIST: Really. Glimmer in the eyes. What about the sloping ape-like forehead?
随机科学家：真的吗。眼中有光芒。那倾斜的类猿额头呢？
Back at home, Marge and Homer watch this on their television.
在家里，玛吉和荷马在电视上观看这个节目。
HOMER: Oh, the guys at work are gonna have a field day with this.
荷默：哦，工作上的那些人会为了这事乐坏的。
MARGE: Cheer up, Homer. At least they let you go.
玛姬：振作点，荷默。至少他们放你走了。
GERMAN SCIENTIST: Gentlemen, gentlemen, fraulein, please. This much I believe we can agree upon: this specimen is either a below-average human being or a brilliant beast.
德国科学家：先生们，先生们，小姐，请。至少这一点我们可以达成共识：这个标本要么是个平庸的人类，要么是个聪明的兽类。
HOMER (scoffs): Stupid egghead.
荷默（嗤之以鼻）：愚蠢的书呆子。
He turns the TV off.
他关掉了电视。
MARGE: Oh, Homer. My brilliant beast.
玛姬：哦，霍默。我的聪明野兽。
She kisses him on the cheek and turns off the light.
她在他脸颊上亲了一下，然后关了灯。
FADE OUT
画面淡出
CREDITS BEGIN
字幕开始
THE END.
结束。

The-Simpsons/S01/01x08---The-Telltale-He.title: 01x08 - The Telltale Head
The-Simpsons/S01/01x08---The-Telltale-He.content:
泄露真相的头颅
FADE IN:
淡入：
HOMER and BART walk along a dark street at night. Bart carries some object in his hands.

莫开始抽泣。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
The Springfield Retirement Home, where ABE SIMPSON sits on a bench along with other seniors.
斯普林菲尔德养老院，阿贝·辛普森和其他老人一起坐在长椅上。
ABE: I said it before, and I’ll say it again. “Hell in a handbasket!” I hope they find the punk who did this, and I hope they cut his head off.
阿贝：我以前说过，现在再说一遍。“天要塌下来了！”我希望他们能抓到干这事的小子，我希望他们把他的头砍下来。
SENIORS: Yeah!
老人们：是啊！
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Bart, who spies Jimbo, Kearny, and the other bully lying on a field of grass. Nearby, a sign says “Keep off the Grass”
巴特看到吉姆博、柯尼和其他恶霸躺在一片草地上。附近有一个牌子写着“勿践踏草坪”
BART: Hi, guys. What’s up?
巴特：嗨，伙计们。怎么了？
JIMBO: We were just saying we’d love to meet the guy who cut off the head of that statue.
吉姆博：我们刚在说真想见到把那座雕像头砍掉的家伙。
OTHER BULLY: Yeah, we wish he were here right now.
另一个恶霸：是啊，我们希望他现在就在这里。
BART: Oh, really?
巴特：哦，真的吗？
Bart zips open his bag.
巴特拉开他的包。
KEARNY: Yeah, we’d break every bone in his stupid little body.
柯尼：是啊，我们会把他那愚蠢小小身体的每根骨头都弄断。
Bart zips the bag back up.
巴特又把包拉上。
JIMBO: Yeah, that’s right, man. Limb by limb.
JIMBO：
对，没错，伙计。肢解，寸步不让。
ALL: Yeah!
众人：耶！
BART: What? But—but yesterday didn’t you say it would be cool to cut off the head, and really cheese everybody off?
BART：
什么？可是——可是你昨天不是说砍下头会很酷，会把大家气个半死吗？
KEARNY: Yeah, that was just cloud talk, man.
KEARNY：
是啊，那只是酒吧里的胡扯，老兄。
JIMBO: Yeah. I mean, throwing rocks is one thing but I would never cut the head off of a guy who iced a bear with his bare hands. So what’s in the bag, Bart?
吉姆博：是啊。我是说，扔石头是一回事，但我绝不会割下一个用赤手空拳打死熊的人的头。所以包里装的是什么，巴特？
Jebediah starts speaking. Only Bart can hear him. I suppose it’s part of his guilt.
杰比戴亚开始说话。只有巴特能听见。我想这是他内疚的一部分。
JEBEDIAH: My head.
杰比戴亚：我的头。
JIMBO: I said, what’s in the bag, Bart?
吉姆博：我问过了，包里装的是什么，巴特？
JEBEDIAH: Go ahead, Bart. Tell them. It’s the head of Jebediah Springfield.
杰贝迪亚：说吧，巴特。告诉他们。那是杰贝迪亚·斯普林菲尔德的头。
BART: I gotta go.
巴特：我要走了。
He runs off with the bag and finds himself at the park. A gigantic group of people stare at the incomplete statue.
他提着袋子跑到公园，发现一大群人盯着那座残缺的雕像。
JEBEDIAH: Look what you’ve done. You wanted to be popular. Now you’re the most hated boy in town.
杰贝迪亚：看看你干的好事。你想要受欢迎。现在你成了镇上最被憎恨的男孩。
BART: You’re not really talking to me. You’re just my overactive imagination.
巴特：你其实并不是在跟我说话。你只是我过度活跃的想象。
JEBEDIAH: Oh, I am, am I?
杰贝戴亚：哦，是吗？
BART: Shut up. I wanted them to like me.
巴特：闭嘴。我只是想要他们喜欢我。
Bart walks past Burns and Moe.
巴特走过伯恩斯和莫伊。
BURNS: Hmm. That child seems rattled.
伯恩斯：嗯。那个孩子看起来很慌张。
MOE: Can you blame him?
莫：你能责怪他吗？
BURNS: No. No, I can’t.
伯恩斯：不。不，我不能。
Burns cries into his arms. SMITHERS taps him on the back.
伯恩斯把脸埋进手臂里哭。史密瑟斯拍了拍他的背。
SMITHERS: There, there, Mr. Burns. Blow, sir.
史密瑟斯：好啦好啦，伯恩斯先生。用力，先生。
Burns blows his nose on a tissue.
伯恩斯用纸巾擤鼻涕。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Bart, who walks into his house. Maggie and Lisa sit on the couch, watching TV. Bart starts making his way into the kitchen when---
巴特走进他的房子。玛吉和莉萨坐在沙发上看电视。巴特正往厨房走去——
LISA: Hey, Bart, where are you going?
莉萨：嘿，巴特，你要去哪儿？
BART: Uh, to my room.
巴特：呃，回我的房间。
LISA: Why don’t you watch Krusty the Clown?
丽莎：你为什么不看看小丑克鲁斯蒂的节目？
KRUSTY (on TV): There’s someone out there in Krustyland who has committed an atrocity. If you know who cut off Jebediah’s head --- I don’t care if it’s your brother, your sister, your daddy, or your mommy --- turn them in and Krusty will send you a free slide whistle just like Sideshow Bob’s.
克鲁斯蒂（电视上）：克鲁斯蒂乐园里有人犯下了滔天大罪。如果你知道谁砍下了杰比迪亚的头——我才不管是你哥哥、你姐姐、你爸爸还是你妈妈——把他们举报了，克鲁斯蒂就会寄给你一个免费的滑音哨，就像配角鲍勃那样的。
Bob whistles on the television.
鲍勃在电视上吹哨子。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
The yard, where Bart digs a hole with his shovel. The head rests on the ground, talking to him.
院子里，巴特用铲子挖了一个洞。头颅躺在地上，和他说话。
JEBEDIAH: Wait a minute. I hope you’re not planning to do what I think you’re doing.
杰比迪亚：等一下。我希望你不要打算做我认为你要做的事。
BART: Sorry, man, it’s either you or me.
巴特：抱歉，伙计，不是你就是我。
JEBEDIAH: You know, Bart, you don’t have to found a town to be a hero. Sometimes a hero can be a young boy with the courage to stand up and admit he’s made a mistake.
杰比迪亚：你知道吗，巴特，你不必创建一个城镇才能成为英雄。有时，英雄可以是一个勇于站出来承认自己错误的年轻男孩。
BART: Yeah, well, I’m running a little short on courage right now.
巴特：嗯，我现在有点缺乏勇气。
Bart throws him into the hole.
巴特把他扔进洞里。
JEBEDIAH: Aah! Anyway, think about it, will you, son?
杰比戴：啊！不管怎样，好好想想，好吗，儿子？
Bart looks down meaningfully at the head and groans.
巴特意味深长地低头看着那颗头，轻声呻吟。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
Back inside the house where Homer, Marge, Lisa, and Maggie watch TV.
屋内，荷马、玛姬、丽莎和玛吉在看电视。
TV REPORTER: Jebediah Obediah Zachariah Jebediah Springfield came West in 1838.
电视播报员：杰贝迪亚·奥贝迪亚·扎卡赖亚·杰贝迪亚·斯普林菲尔德于 1838 年来到西部。
The title on the TV reads: Springfield A City Held Hostage Day One.
电视上的标题写着：斯普林菲尔德一座被挟持的城市 第一天。
Jebediah is shown chopping a log. A bear emerges out of the tree and Jebediah throws his axe away.
画面显示杰贝迪亚在劈木头。一只熊从树丛中出现，杰贝迪亚把他的斧头扔掉。
TV REPORTER: Along the way he met a ferocious bear and k*lled him with his bare hands. That’s “B-A-R-E” hands.
电视记者：一路上他遇到一只凶猛的熊，并用赤手空拳把它打死。那是“B-A-R-E”（赤手）手。
Jebediah wrestles the bear to the ground.
杰贝迪亚把熊摔倒在地。
TV REPORTER: Although modern historians recently uncovered evidence that the bear, in fact, probably k*lled him. But whether bear k*lled man---
电视记者：不过现代历史学家最近发现证据表明，那只熊实际上可能把他给咬死了。但不管是熊咬死了人——
BART: Mom. Dad.
巴特：妈妈。爸爸。
Bart holds up the head in front of the family.
巴特把那个头举到家人面前。
HOMER: I knew it all along!
荷马：我早就知道了！
MARGE: Why, Bart? Why?
玛姬：为什么，巴特？为什么？
HOMER: Yeah, why? You little---.
荷马：是啊，为什么？你这个小——。
Homer st*lks menacingly towards Bart.
霍默威胁性地朝巴特走去。
BART: Because I wanted some really bad kids to like me. Somehow I got the idea of being popular was the most important thing in the world.
巴特：因为我真想让那些很酷的孩子喜欢我。不知怎么的，我竟以为受欢迎是世界上最重要的事。
MARGE: Where did you get a ridiculous idea like that?
玛姬：你哪儿冒出这种荒谬的想法的？
Homer cringes between his teeth.
霍默在牙缝间皱着脸。
HOMER: Uhh --- lay off the boy, Marge. He’s a good kid. Quit giving him the third degree.
霍默：呃——别欺负那个男孩了，玛姬。他是个好孩子。别再刨根问底了。
MARGE: Homer, did you have something to do with this?
玛姬：霍默，这事儿跟你有关系吗？
HOMER: Well, maybe I am a little responsible.
霍默：唔，也许我有点责任。
MARGE: A little?
玛姬：有点？
HOMER: Come on, son. Let’s take the head thing back to the authorities.
霍默：来吧，儿子。我们把那颗头的事交给当局吧。
CUT TO:
切换镜头：
The same sequence as in the beginning of the episode. Homer and Bart walk along the dark street.
与剧集开头相同的场景。霍默和巴特沿着漆黑的街道走着。
HOMER: You know, Bart, when I was your age, I pulled a few boners. But I think you’ll find that people are pretty decent if you give them half—
霍默：你知道吗，巴特，我你这个年纪的时候也犯过几次错。但我想你会发现，如果你至少给人们一半的——
Once again, they turn the corner and they find themselves facing the bloodthirsty crowd.
他们再次拐弯，发现自己面对着那群嗜血的民众。
BURNS: Look, there it is, the head!
伯恩斯：看，那里，那个头！
KRUSTY: k*ll him!
克拉斯蒂：把他干掉！
Homer and Bart set off on a run.
霍默和巴特开始跑起来。
BARNEY (present): All right. All right.
巴尼（现在）：好吧。好吧。
KRUSTY (present): We know this part.
KRUSTY（
现在）：我们知道这一段。
BART (present): Oh, yeah, right.
BART（
现在）：哦，对，没错。
DISSOLVE TO:
画面溶解到：
Bart and Homer around the statue the crowd still gathering around them.
巴特和霍默在雕像周围，人群还在聚拢他们。
BART: Well, that’s my story. And if you still wanna tear apart this young Sunday school student as he stands on the brink of salvation, I await your wrath.
BART：
好吧，这就是我的故事。如果你们还想在这位正站在救赎边缘的年轻主日学学生身上撕裂开来，我等着你们的愤怒。
CROWD: Aw!
人群：哎！
KRUSTY: Somehow I don’t feel like k*lling anymore.
小丑克拉斯蒂：不知怎么的，我现在没那么想杀人了。
EDNA KRABAPPEL: Neither do I.
埃德娜·克拉巴佩尔：我也不想了。
BART: Dad.
巴特：爸爸。
Homer hands the head to Bart. The crowd watches in excitement. Even Kearny and Jimbo are there.
霍默把那颗头交给巴特。人群兴奋地观望。连科尼和吉姆博也在场。
BART (thinking): Forgive me, sir.
巴特（心想）：请原谅我，先生。
JEBEDIAH: No problem, Bart.
杰贝迪亚：没关系，巴特。
Bart places the head on top.
巴特把那颗头放在上面。
DR. MARVIN: Look! It’s glorious.
马文博士：看！多壮观啊。
OTTO: It’s beautiful, man.
奥托：太美了，伙计。
BURNS: I love you, Smithers.
伯恩斯：我爱你，史密瑟斯。
SMITHERS: The feeling is more than mutual, sir.
史密瑟斯：这份感情比您更温厚，长官。
The crowd cheers and applauds as Bart jumps into Homer’s arms.
人群欢呼鼓掌，巴特跳进荷马的怀里。
HOMER: Whoo!
荷马：呼！
DISSOLVE TO;
画面溶解至；
Homer and Bart walking away from the scene. The crowd continues to stare at the statue.
荷马和巴特走离现场。人群仍然盯着那座雕像。
HOMER: Good going, son. But remember --- most lynch mobs aren’t this nice.
霍默：干得好，儿子。但记住——大多数私刑暴徒可没有这么客气。
FADE OUT
画面淡出
CREDITS BEGIN
片头字幕开始
THE END.
结束。
